Sets all filters here back to starting values. A Shop must be reselected before the Submit button is available. After the filters have been chosen press Submit to see all Receive Goods that match the filters. To create a new Receive Goods. See the How to Create a New Receive Goods section. Created The date the Receive Goods was originally made. Title The title given when the Receive Goods was created or last edited. Vendor The Vendor associated with this Receive Goods. Total Quantity Shows the total number of items on the Receive Goods. Can be used a quick 'check sum' when comparing the Receive Goods against the delivery note. Total Cost Shows the total Cost of the Receive Goods as Quantity x Cost. Currency The selected currency this Receive Goods will be completed in.

title: How to Create a New Receive Goods
text: In order to make a new Receive Goods you will need to nominate a Shop, Vendor and Currency as well as give the Receive Goods a Title. You also have the option to link a Receive Goods to a Purchase Order, create a Receive Goods Number and add some Notes. From the Receive Goods screen use the Create New button You must complete some header information before you can populate the Receive Goods with item. This is so you do not add items you shop does not stock or those the vendor does not supply. Title You must give the Receive Goods a title in line with your business guidelines. This title should be meaningful as you will see it on reports and in other areas of Imagine. Shop Choose a shop where this Receive Goods will apply stock to. The shop will be preselected for you based on the overview page. The Save button is not available until a shop and other mandatory information has been selected. Purchase Order Optionally choose a linked Purchase Order (PO). Items in the PO will be added directly to this Goods receive. You must select a Vendor before any selection are available here. Notes Add any notes you see fit. These only relate to this specific Goods Receive and can only be seen here. Receive Goods Number Either enter your own Receive Goods Number or leave blank and Imagine will generate this for you. Select Vendor Choose a vendor where this Receive Goods will be sent to. The Save button is not available until a vendor and other mandatory information has been selected. Currency Select the currency this Receive Goods will be completed in. Used to mark the Receive Goods as complete, after no more goods will be received against it. You will not be able to edit this Goods receive after it has been Committed. Only available when an item has been added to the Receive Goods and the Save button is available. Used to save progress on this Receive Goods, but without finalising it as Completed. Useful if you are part way through booking in a delivery and need to save your progress. Only available when all mandatory information is completed. Used to return to the overview page, any changes made since your last Save will be lost. Linked Purchase Order To link a Receive Goods to a PO, you can choose from the available placed POs associated with the selected shop and vendor in the "Purchase Order" dropdown. If no POs are displayed, it means there are no POs that match the combination of the selected shop and vendor, or the POs have not been placed yet. Once you select a PO, the items ordered will be displayed in the "Add Item" section, where you can adjust the quantities to reflect the actual received quantities. Manually adding items See Adding Items to a Receive Goods for details how to manually add items to a Receive Goods. Manually adding items is used when you do not have a linked PO, or if the delivered goods do not match those expected on the PO. Cost (total) Shows the total Cost of the Receive Goods as Quantity x Cost Quantity (total) Shows the total number of items on the Receive Goods. Can be used a quick 'check sum' when comparing the Receive Goods against the delivery note. Item table functions Export All Data This will export the data to a .xlxs file for use. Column Chooser Use to select/deselect columns you wish to use. Print Used to print labels, see Printing Labels for further information.

title: How to edit a Creating Receive Goods
text: From the Receive Goods overview page select a Receive Goods to edit it. Only Receive Goods that have a status of Creating can be edited. Receive Goods with a status of Completed can be viewed but not edited, for example the Save and Commit button will not be available to you. You can edit the header information apart from the Receive Goods Number. A shop must be selected before the Save button is available. See the How to Create a New Receive Goods article for details of what is required for the header information. At least one item must be added to the Receive Goods before you are able to Save and Commit. Saving and Committing will mark the Receive Goods status as Complete. To Add items to the Receive Goods see the Adding Items to a Receive Good page. Used to mark the Receive Goods as complete, after no more goods will be received against it. You will not be able to edit this Goods receive after it has been Committed. Only available when an item has been added to the Receive Goods and the Save button is available. Used to save progress on this Receive Goods, but without finalising it as Completed. Useful if you are part way through booking in a delivery and need to save your progress. Only available when all mandatory information is completed. Used to return to the overview page, any changes made since your last Save will be lost. Receive Goods documents can be downloaded as PDF’s. Select the required Receive Goods from the list and click the "Download PDF" this will then begin the PDF generation and you will see a notification "Generating PDF - Please Wait". Depending on which browser you are using your generated PDF will be in your download folder click this to open the PDF. Item table functions Export All Data This will export the data to a .xlxs file for use. Column Chooser Use to select/deselect columns you wish to use. Print Used to print labels, see Printing Labels for further information.

title: Adding Items to a Receive Goods
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Manually Via a Purchase Order There are two ways in which items can be populated on to a Receive Goods, manually or via Purchase Order. Manually: you add each item as needed to the Receive Goods via barcodes or lookups. Via a Purchase Order: you are able to pick a Purchase Order to link to your Receive Goods. When you do this the list of items on a Receive Goods will taken from the linked Purchase Order. Manually To Add items manually to a Goods Receive you must not have selected to receive from a purchase order, that is, on the Receive Goods the Purchase Order field is not populated with a Purchase Order Number. Add by barcode: Ensure the Add by barcode field is selected and then scan a product barcode. On recognising a know barcode this filed will add the item to the grid. If the item already exists, the quantity will be incremented by 1 for each scan. If the barcode is not linked to an item then you will be prompted that no item was found. This field will only recognise barcodes as listed in the Barcodes field on the item matrix tab. You can type the barcode rather than scanning it if you do not have a barcode scanner available. Lookup button: Use the "Lookup" button to display the Add Items window. From this screen, you can search for items based on any item's properties. By entering a quantity or using the +/- buttons to increment the quantity, you can populate the grid. Once you have set the quantities for all items, select "Add Items" to include them in the Receive Goods. Via a Purchase Order To populate a receive goods from an existing purchase order, follow these steps: Select a vendor: Choose the desired vendor from the available options. Choose the Purchase Order drop-down: Click on the Purchase Order drop-down menu to view the list of available placed purchase orders. Select a purchase order: Once you have chosen a purchase order, the item grid will automatically be populated with the items to receive, and the quantity will be pre-set based on the purchase order. Note: over-receiving quantities on a purchase order are only allowed when the "Allow over-receive of PO" setting is enabled in the Shops Details section of Back Office. If this option is not enabled, over-receiving is not possible. Note: it is not possible to add additional items within the Goods Receipt Note when it is linked to a purchase order. In such cases, a new goods receipt or purchase order must be created to receive items that are not already listed in the original purchase order. Note: once a purchase order is placed, it cannot be altered, except where the "Allow Placed purchase orders to be changed" option is enabled in Portal Configuration. This allows the Quantity and Cost values only to be altered.

title: Printing Labels
text: Clicking the print option, a pop-up window will appear as shown below. To proceed with printing, you need to complete the following steps: Select and set a label template for all items: Before printing, a label template must be chosen and set for each item. This can be done individually for each item or by selecting a template from the top drop-down menu and choosing "Set All" to apply it to all items. Select a connector for printing: Choose a connector that connects to the desired printing device. This allows the system to communicate with the printer and send the print commands appropriately. In the lower grid section of the pop-up, you have the option to save the selected template as the default template for the master item. By choosing "Save the template to master item," you can overwrite the current default template set for the master item. Once you have completed these steps, you can initiate the printing process by pressing the "Print" button.

title: Shop Currency Rates
text: Here you can add or amend shop currency rates. Shop Currency rates are used when a shop/location accepts other forms of currency as payments. Select which shop location you wish to set Currency Rates. From the drop-down currency, menu select which currency is required. Then input the exchange rate required. Then to add the new currency rate click "Add Exchange Rate" this will then add the Currency to the table below. Edit - If you need to make changes to the rate. Save - Will keep any changes you make. Undo/Return - Will stop any changes being currently made without saving. Delete - Removes the added currency. NOTE: When deleting a currency you will be asked to confirm via a pop-up as shown below. Yes - Will remove the line. No - Will return you to the list of currencies.

title: POS Options
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Options Tab Discounts Tab Customer Display Tab By selecting specific checkboxes and saving, you can modify certain parameters related to the POS. To undo any changes, simply uncheck the boxes and save. Note: Any field with a asterisk is required information. Options Tab Hide last sale details when clerk is logged out. The last sale total and change will show 0.00 rather than the actual amounts. Hide chart on POS. The sales chart on the POS log-in screen will not be displayed. Ask if customer will receive receipt as mail. NOTE: This option is overridden when the “The receipt should be emailed instead of printed as default” option is active, if unchecked the following will be available at the PoS. A receipt will automatically be printed whether this option is checked or unchecked. When unchecked the option to E-Mail Receipt will not be available at the PoS irrespective of whether a customer with a valid email is selected or not. When this option is checked the clerk will have the option to E-Mail the Receipt NOTE: If a customer is selected and has a valid email address, the receipt will be sent directly to this email address when the 'E-Mail Receipt' button is selected The receipt should be emailed instead of printed as default. NOTE: This option will override the “Ask if customer will receive receipt as mail” when checked and will... Not print a receipt automatically at the PoS. Offer a Print Receipt option. The clerk can choose this to print a receipt. Offer an E-mail Receipt option. The clerk can enter an email address to send the receipt to. NOTE: If a customer is selected and has a valid email address, the receipt will be sent directly to this email address when the 'E-Mail Receipt' button is selected Allow the clerk to either Print Receipt or send an E-Mail Receipt. Only one option can be chosen, but not both. Stay logged in after finished sale. The clerk will stay logged in after the sale is complete without being prompted for their log-in details again. The clerk must manually log out if stepping away from the POS. Automatically aggregate identical item lines in a transaction. Items with the same barcode will be listed on the POS under a single line when this option is checked. The receipt will also show a single line with a multiple quantity value. Allow overcharging of payment cards. This option allows for surcharges to be put onto receipt. Only managers can do returns. When this option is checked, only a member of management will be able to authorize returns or transaction requiring management credentials. See @Clerk for more information. Discounts Tab POS Discount Buttons Use the options here to set the discount buttons on the PoS to values suitable to your needs (see Line Discount for more details). Customer Display Tab NOTE: This is to be used if you have a customer facing screen or display the on screen configurations can be made via Admin>Shop Setup>Customer Display. Shop Display Name* Input the shop name Display Option* Image Carousel - Choosing this you will see the Image Media Library appear from here you can add the images in various ways, the images you choose will c on the customer display. NOTE: You will need to set the interval time in the Display Interval field. Fixed Image - This will be one static image. Once selected you will see the option for Image Media Library appear. Fixed Text - This is static text no images will show, this should be used alongside Static Line Display Customer Display Logo URL This allows you to select a web page which can display branding of the store. If linking to an insecure site (HTTP) for the External Site, you will need to ''allow content' in the Customer Display widget if the browser actively blocks the content. Static Line Display This is the text that will show when using the Fixed Text option. Receipt Timeout This is the amount of time the receipt will stay on screen set in seconds. Display Interval* If you have Image Carousel set then this will be the amount if time the images show for on rotation. Background Colour Used to choose the background colour from the drop down menu using the colour picker or input the relevant hex code or RGB Values. Text Colour Used to choose the text colour from the drop down menu using the colour picker or input the relevant hex code or RGB Values. Show Customer Display on Monitor Number* This allows you to choose which display the External Site gets automatically popped out to (you must be using the K3 Imagine Chrome Extension for this to work)

title: General Information
text: General information is used for shop information Select the shop you wish to use. These details are of the shop you selected. When you have filled in the relevant fields click save a notification will appear to confirm saving

title: Customer Orders
text: This when set will be how long a store/shop will physically hold onto a click and collect item in-store until it is returned. Input the required amount of days and click Save you will see a confirmation message appear in the top right of the screen.

title: K3 Connector Manager
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Adding a New Connector Verifone Configuration Updating / Rebooting the Connector NOTE: Before setup ensure you have Installed Certification. Adding a New Connector NOTE: When adding a new connector and configuring it to a store, it may take up to 10 minutes to complete. When it has finished, you will receive a startup notification printout. Choose which location you need the connector set up for. If there are no Connectors visible then there is none currently set up for this location. To add a new Connector click on the ADD DEVICE for your store. NOTE: You can add multiple Connectors at once if required. Save When a new Connector along with the information has been added this will save the options. Connector Name This is the name given to the Connector / Device (e.g. Front Till 01). Connector ID The ID given from the start-up slip which is printed when the Connector is first booted, for more information see @Assembling the Connector. NOTE: *The ID must be exactly 6 groups of 2 numerals or letters (0 to 9, A to F) and each pair separated by a - Connector Terminal Choose the type of integrated card terminal in use, if there is no integrated card unit present choose the "No payment service provider" option. Most integrations require the IP address and port number for the terminal. Connector Printer Choose from the options for 'DdD' (K3 Receipt Printer) or 'Epson' these options help to determine specific paper sizes and receipt logo printing settings. Mark for deletion When set to 'On' the related connector will be deleted from this store when Save is clicked. Virtual Connector Reserved for future use. Verifone Configuration Updating / Rebooting the Connector If your Connector requires a reboot or update and has been installed where it is inaccessible you can reboot via the POS Screen. Locate the Connector symbol in the top right menu. The Connectors available will show below. Press the to reboot the Connector. A message will appear for you to confirm a reboot. Once rebooted you will receive the following message. Your Connector will now be rebooted. NOTE: You do not need to re-add the Connector via the back office module.

title: Gift Voucher Setup
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Gift Settings Voucher Settings Gift Settings In this section, you can adjust the printing settings for gift receipts and gift labels. Gift receipts and gift labels are specialised receipts that allows customers to buy items as gifts, providing a convenient way for both gift givers and recipients to handle returns or exchanges while maintaining the element of surprise regarding the item's price. Gift receipts and gift labels do not identify the price of an item directly. Gift Printing Options: To modify the type of Gift Receipt or Label, select the desired option from the dropdown menu. Print gift receipt Will only print a gift receipt to the receipt printer Print gift label Will only print a gift label to the label printer Print gift receipt and gift label Will print both a gift receipt and a gift label If you need to print one or both options, ensure that the relevant options are available to the Connector to avoid unexpected results. For more information on compatible hardware, please refer to the POS Hardware documentation. Once you have set all your preferences, click Save to apply the changes. You will receive a confirmation message upon successful saving. Gift Label Template: If Print Gift Label is selected you will need to select which Label Template to print from the drop down menu. Select default exchange period type: To set up the Default Exchange Period, choose from the drop down menu. You can choose between Number of Days or Until Specific Date. This will change the type of Default Exchange Period accordingly. Number of Days If your returns policy specifies a specific number of days for the return of goods from purchase, select this option and set the Default Exchange Period in days as required. Until specific date You can choose a specific return date if required, this can be useful Christmas return periods for example, where your customers can make returns up to a specific date irrespective of when they purchased the item. Default exchange period: The Default Exchange Period can be either a date or a number of days, depending on the period type you have chosen. For instance, if your return policy specifies a 30-day window from the date of purchase for most of the year, you would select "Number of Days" and input "30" in the "Default Exchange Period (in days)" field. However, during the Christmas period, you may choose to accept returns from 1st January to 15th January, in which case you would need to update the "Select Default Exchange" period type to be 15th January. This information will be displayed on the Gift Label when printed. Voucher Settings The settings here relate to Gift Vouchers, which are also called Gift Certificates. See the Gift Vouchers section in Back Office for more details of set up. Gift Certificate Expiry This is the amount of days from purchase that the Gift Certificate will be valid for. After this date the Gift Voucher will expire automatically. Credit Note Expiry This is the amount of days from issue that the Credit Note will be valid for. After this date the Credit Note will expire automatically.

title: Expansions
text: Introduction To configure the Expansion Framework, go to Admin > Expansions Module. Usually, your K3 representative will handle this setup if needed. The Expansion Framework allows for the setup of third-party extensions, which can be hosted outside of the Imagine platform and triggered during specific instances within the Imagine App transactions. Expansions can offer diverse functionalities beyond what Imagine already provides. The Expansion Framework is mainly intended for Self Serve and Simple POS applications. Typical Uses The Expansion framework in the Imagine App can trigger events at specific points during a transaction, like before payment. When an event is triggered, a unique identifier is sent to a third-party API to identify the session and the basket. Imagine will provide a window for external services to interact with the user and wait for a completion message. Third-party applications can perform custom actions, such as collecting additional information from the user or directly interacting with the Imagine basket object. Expansions allow for additional functions that may not be accessible or relevant to the retailer. For example, a retailer may require a specific feature for their shop, but K3 needs to set up and configure it. The Expansion framework allows the retailer to enable or disable the feature independently. Furthermore, if Clean Cash is enabled for the tenant and shop, the retailer can enable or disable it in this section. For more information about when Clean Cash can be temporarily disabled, refer to the Clean Cash notes. The Expansion framework is primarily available for Self Serve and Simple POS applications. Expansion Selection To begin select the shop/location. To enable an expansion, simply select the desired expansion and toggle the switch to the "on" position. Once you have made your selections, click on "Save". After saving, you should receive a notification that says "Expansions was updated successfully".

title: Store & Colleague Login
text: The Store Login uses your portal Username & Password. The Colleague Login uses Clerk id and Password, you will need to select which store from the dropdown. You will then see a splash screen. NOTE: This can be branded you will need to speak with your sales contact. NOTE: You can navigate away from sections without loosing progress. Tap the menu button located in the top left this will expand to show your menu options. For further options tap the Here you can change various settings or change the location of shop. Settings Here you can choose the following settings Stock Camera Item Sync Stock Here you set the time between scans per second. Camera From here you can choose which camera to use and set the amount of time between scans. Item Sync Force Full Sync - This will sync all items, for example, if you are doing inventory changes this will push those changes to Imagine. Remove Saved Items - This will delete any local data, for example, if you are working offline and you remove saved items they will be permanently deleted. Change Shop This will display all the shops linked to your tenant tap on the shop to change the location. Logout This will log you out of the Companion app and return you to Login Page.

title: Item Information
text: Item Information allows you to scan or search items and retrieve information and properties. Tap for search This allows you to search based on the following attributes. Item Barcode Item Description Press Tap for Search and input either the code/description of the item and press the icon to begin. The search results will then display in a list. Tapping on one of the items in the list will bring up its information. It will display the item information and image if one has been added. Drop-down menus. General Information - This displays the item barcode or item No. Description - If a description has been given for the item it will be displayed here. Nearby Stock - This shows what stock is on hand nearby you can use the slider to increase or decrease the distance. Scan item barcode Tap the camera icon, a small frame will be displayed to scan the item barcode. Scanning the barcode will bring the same information page as if you were to use search.

title: Stocktake
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Ad-Hoc Scheduled Ad-Hoc This is for when you need to do an unscheduled stock check. NOTE: If you leave the Stocktake section your items will be saved and will be restored when you return to scanning. When performing an Ad Hoc count, you will be asked to start scanning or searching for the goods to be counted. Firstly, you will need to select the location from the drop-down menu and tap continue. When a line is scanned/selected it will be added to the count and will display the quantity on hand. If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press Continue to add to the stock check. NOTE: You can review previous counts and edit quantities if an error is made. Scans are timestamped and grouped by a configurable parameter. So, when you scan items with the same barcode they will be consolidated. When a count has been completed (if you have the correct permissions) it can be reviewed and submitted to Imagine, however, quantities are not adjusted at this stage. You will need to use Imagine to commit the count. To remove an item from the stock take list, swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items, use the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the stock count. You will get a confirmation of the stock take submission and the number of lines within the stock take. Scheduled This is used for stock takes that need to be performed on particular dates. NOTE: If you leave the Stocktake section through the device controls such as a gesture or O/S button then your items will be saved and will be restored when you return to scanning. If you leave the Stocktake via the Companion App ‘Back’ button then you will asked if you would like to preserve the stock count or not. When you select a Scheduled Stocktake you will be shown a list of stocktakes that are either Open or Counting. Note: Calculating, Calculated, Closed, Committing or Creating stocktakes are not shown on the Companion App. Once a stocktake is chosen you will be asked to enter a Count Name. A default Count Name based on the current date and time is given. You should enter a Count Name in line with your stocktake procedures. If you click Cancel you will be returned to the list of stocktakes as a Count Name is required to continue into the counting screen. You will then be shown a list of expected items to be scanned on the Stock take. If you scan an item that is not expected in the stock take you will hear an audible beep and a notification will display. Once the correct item is scanned it will be added to the list. NOTE: you can edit the Count Name here using the ‘pencil’ edit icon If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press Continue to accept the updated item count. NOTE: You can review previous counts and edit quantities if an error is made. Scans are timestamped and grouped together, meaning when you scan items with the same barcode they will be consolidated in to a single line and the Count will be updated as necessary. When a count has been completed (if you have the correct permissions) it can be reviewed and submitted to Imagine, however, quantities are not adjusted at this stage. You will need to commit using Imagine. To remove an item from the Stocktake list, swipe the line to the left and press bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items, use the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be prompted to either Add to existing counts, Replace existing counts, or Cancel. Add: counts will be added to any existing counts in Imagine to give you a stocktake Quantity. The Quantity tells you the total stock of that item in your shop Replace: counts will remove matching items from any current counts and this count will be the single value that makes up your stock Quantity in your shop Cancel: will return you to the list of stocktakes, preserving the current count You will get a confirmation of the stocktake submission.

title: Replenishment
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Gap Scan Pick List NOTE: Gap Scan and Pick List are only used within the Companion App. There is no equivalent module in Retail Suite Portal. Gap Scan This is for when you have gaps on the shelves so items that are out of stock this will generate a replenishment list. When you start a Gap Scan you will need to select the location. As you scan the gaps they will be put into a list. If you incorrectly scan a line you can remove it by swiping the line to the left and tapping the bin icon to delete. When you have finished scanning the items use the checkmark in the top right hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm submission of the stock count. You will than be asked to start again or go to pick list. NOTE: If you choose to Go to Pick List you will be shown the pick list you have just created. Pick List This is a list generated when a gap scan has been completed. Once you have completed a Gap Scan a Pick list is then used to find the missing lines. The information on screen will show who created the pick list the time it was created and the number of lines. Select which pick list you require you will then see the list of items (previously added via Gap Scan) you need for replenishment. Once the item is found, you can use the check box to confirm its available for replenishment. When you have finished picking the items use the checkmark in the top right hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm submission of the stock count. NOTE: If you try to finish the pick without marking the check boxes you will be presented with the below warning. Once you have pressed Confirm you will be given a notification that the Pick list was successfully submitted. The pick list will now be removed from the list.

title: Store Information
text: The Store Information shows you various financial data across days, weeks and months. NOTE: This section is purely for reviewing financial data however this information is also available via various sources in the Retail Suite Portal. There is no direct comparison for layout or UI of the Companion App in the Retail Suite Portal.

title: Transfer
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Create List Create This is for when you need to send items to another store. When creating a new transfer you will be asked to choose which destination you are transferring to along with a description. NOTE: If a Shop or Vendor has been Blocked for Transfer these will not appear in the list. Begin scanning or use the search to add the transfer lines. NOTE: If you try to ship items which will send them into a negative quantity, a prompt will appear confirming the order line that has been over-scanned. The line can be altered and then recommitted. You can alter the quantity if necessary by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press continue to add to the stock check. To remove an item from the Transfer list swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark icon in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Transfer. You will be sent to a confirmation screen from here you can start again or check the transfers by going to List. List This shows the Transfers that have been created. Here you will see a list of created transfers, along with the date the transfer was made. You can review the transfer by clicking on the required transfer. This section is purely for reviewing Transfers. 8 This is the total quantity transferred. 3 This is the total number of lines transferred.

title: Receiving
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Transfer In Purchase Orders Auto Receive Transfers In Auto Receive Purchase Orders Click & Collect Transfer In This is for when a transfer is being accepted by the receiving shop/store. You will see a list of transfers that have been created select the one required. Scan the items within the transfer list and they will move to a Scanned Items List below. It will show how many were sent and how many you have received. If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press Continue to add to the Transfer amount. To remove an item once it's been scanned/added swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Transfer. You will be sent to a confirmation screen. Purchase Orders Used when a PO has been delivered and being accepted into the shop/store. When a Purchase Order has been created via the Inventory Module within Imagine, those orders will show here. The list will show which items are expected when you receive the PO. Locate and scan the items on the list this will then be moved to Scanned Items. You can alter the quantity if necessary by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press continue to add to the Transfer amount. To remove an item once it's been scanned/added swipe the line to the left and tap the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to approve receiving. If you confirm you will see the below message. The PO will now be removed from the list. Auto Receive Transfers In This is when a transfer can be received automatically this is a faster way to accept transfers. This is where you can easily receive a Transfer from other stores without having to scan individual items in, You will need to search or scan the transfer details. Once the transfer is located it will show various details on the screen. NOTE: If you tap Show Lines this will list the items that should be in the Transfer, this helps when checking if there are any items missing or if quantities are different. Once you have checked the items on the list and confirmed use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to approve receiving. You will receive the below notification the PO has now been received. Auto Receive Purchase Orders When a Purchase Order has been created via the Inventory Module within Imagine, this is where you receive those POs You can scan or search for the reference number that was given to the PO at creation. NOTE: If you press the Show Lines this will list the items that should be in the PO, this helps when checking if there are any items missing or if quantities are different. Once you have checked the items on the list and confirmed use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to approve receiving. You will receive the below notification the PO has now been received. Click & Collect Click & Collect in Receiving is for when a customer has placed an online order to be picked up from a store/shop and the parcel is scanned in upon receiving. Once the customer order arrives you can scan or search for the order number. NOTE: You can add multiple orders at the same time. Once you have located and scanned the order(s) use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm receiving of the order(s). Confirm - This will finish the Receiving process. Cancel - This will take you back to the scanning page. If you confirm the receiving of the order(s) you will see Submission Successful. NOTE: Click & Collect orders that are scanned into the store/shop will show in inventory until a customer picks up the order.

title: Click & Collect
text: Click & Collect is used when a customer comes to pick up their web order(s). The customer should have an order number (this is scanned when the order is received by the store/shop) Once the order has been located you will see information regarding the order these can be used to confirm the customer's identity. Once you have seen the customer's ID you can tick the Validation box. NOTE: The checkmark will only appear once the Validation box has been ticked. When you click the checkmark you will be asked to confirm. Confirm - This will finish the Click & Collect process. Cancel - This will take you back to the Click & Collect page. If you confirm the Click & Collect has been received, you will see a notification of Submission Successful NOTE: Click & Collect orders will now be removed from inventory.

title: Adjustments
text: Adjustments are made when you have identified an item in-store which has an incorrect stock level and requires adjustment. You can either Scan or search for an item. To alter quantities tap the line you wish to alter and use the - or + buttons or the numpad to input the new quantity. Tap continue to make the adjustment. Adjustment Reason Additional Found - If you have found more stock than expected or showing On Hand. Unable to Locate - If you make an adjustment that is -0 and there is no stock on hand in-store but its showing in inventory. To remove an item from the adjustment list, swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm submission of the Adjustments. Once confirmed you will see the below notification.

title: Return To Vendor
text: Return To Vendor is used when an item needs to be sent back from the store to the Vendor (supplier) of the item. Select the Vendor you are sending the item back to and use a Reference, this could be a number or description. Scan or search for the item(s) to be sent back to add these to the return. You can either scan or search for an item. To alter quantities tap the line you wish to alter and use the - or + buttons or the Numpad to input the new quantity. Tap continue. To remove an item from the stocktake list swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items, use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Returns. Cancel - You will be returned to the scanning page. Confirm - You will then see a Submission Successful message appear from here, and you can begin a new submission.

title: Stocktake Page
text: Stock takes can be created for all items in a shop or can be partially based on certain criteria, such as a vendor, a hierarchy [department/category], a custom attribute, an item or left blank for random selection. It is recommended that stocktaking for items is performed whilst there is no POS or back-office activity for the items in a shop as stocktaking is done in real-time. Stocktake Cycle This is an overview of a typical cycle of stocktake from start to finish. Pick a suitable quiet time to stocktake. Preparation of items for stocktake. Open/declare a stocktake in Imagine. Count all items and add to the opened Stocktake. Run a Calculation to generate a stock discrepancy report. Check and compare the discrepancy report. If required – Make stock adjustments and re-calculate. Repeat until the discrepancy report is accepted. Commit Stocktake to update new stock figures to Imagine and Close Stocktake. This section displays all stocktakes within Imagine. From here you can view and manage the contents of each status created, in progress or completed. A filter option will help reduce or expand the list of stocktakes. Create New Creates a new stocktake. Search Text A search will be made on the description field of the stocktake list. Shop The drop-down shows a list of all active shops available for selection. Show Stocktakes in Status This shows a list of stocktake statuses that are available to select. Tick on or off to show in the list. More than one can be selected. Select All Displays all stocktake statuses. Open A stocktake has been opened but no counts added. i.e., No activity. Counting A stocktake which has been opened and in the process of adding counts or has had some counts added. Calculating A stocktake is in the process of calculating stocktake figures. This is the comparison between counted and what is on hand, commonly referred to as the discrepancy. Calculated A stocktake which finished calculating and ready to show the discrepancy. Closed A stocktake which has been calculated and committed. Stock-on-hand figures now reflect the stock counts. Committing A stocktake which is in the process of updating the calculated stock figures to replace the current on-hand stock figures. Creating A stocktake which is in the process of being created. Search Displays a list of stocktakes based on the filter and search parameters. No of Items Per Page The list will show a default number of stocktakes, but this can be changed to 5, 10, 20, or 40 per page from the page option bottom left of the list [5 10 20 40]. Page selection when When there are more stocktakes available than the Items Per Page setting, the page selection displays the number of stocktakes and the number of Pages available bottom right of the list. Click on the page number to see more. [Page 1 of 3 (15 items)]. Recycle Bin A stocktake can be deleted if it is open or in progress. It will not appear against a closed stocktake as these are not permitted to be deleted. Current stock figures are not affected at this stage.

title: POS Layout
text: The sub-menus for Button Management and Clerk Roles are organized into logical sections. The following diagram shows the POS divided into essential sections. Familiarizing yourself with these sections will help you choose the correct button to manage. Header Displays notifications, date, time and store / clerk information. Receipt This is where you interact with items for sales and other functions within the POS. The Receipt Item Line This is specifically the Receipt screen when you have added an item to the POS, rather than an Item Group, Expense, Gift Certificate, Account Deposit or Set. Widgets The function of Widgets can be enabled and disabled by your K3 representative, account manager or support staff. Right Menu POS Function This is where you interact with day-to-day functions within the POS that are not directly related to finding items in the database.

title: Header
text: Below shows the icons which will be displayed on the POS Header and their function. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Header section. POS Offline. Show Widgets. Show Connector Selection. Toggle Full Screen. Show Header Notifications. Show Aside Menu. Header Notifications are accessed by clicking the Show Header Notifications button. To activate these buttons use the Header Notifications section in Button Management.

title: Receipt
text: Search Item (see Search Item below) NOTE: A similar looking button also appears in Payment and must be independently managed there. NOTE: A similar looking button also appears in Payment and must be independently managed there. Process Payment. Total Amount Total Percent Left Discount Button. Right Discount Button Search Item Within the items listed each will show with two buttons. If a button is disabled in Button Management, then this will apply to all items. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Search Item section. Add to Basket. Print Label. Receipt Item Line To set Button Management for these buttons use the Receipt Item Line section. New Line Price, shows the on-screen keyboard to input a new line price. Delete Line. Add Text. Return Item. Sales Rep. Print Gift Receipt Deliver Required. Exclude Line from Loyalty. NOTE: When the button is green, it indicates that the line is included in loyalty. Conversely, if toggled to red, the line will be excluded from loyalty. Remove Discount. Quantity. Minus Quantity. Add Quantity. Amount Discount. Percentage Discount. Left Discount Button. Right Discount Button. Receipt Item Group When you add an Item Group item to a transaction, it creates an Item Group line on the receipt. The buttons on the Item Group line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. If you need to manage these buttons, go to the Receipt Item Group section to adjust the Button Management settings. Receipt Gift Certificate Adding a Gift Certificate item to a transaction results in a Gift Certificate line on the receipt. The buttons on the Gift Certificate line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. For instance, you might want to enable the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Gift Certificate line. To configure Button Management settings for these buttons, access the Receipt Gift Certificate section. Receipt Account Deposit If you add an Account Deposit item to the transaction, it creates an Account Deposit line on the receipt. The buttons on the Account Deposit line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they function independently. For instance, you may want to enable the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Account Deposit line. To manage these buttons, navigate to the Receipt Account Deposit section and configure the Button Management settings accordingly. Receipt Sell Set When you add a Sell Set group of items to the transaction this is known as a Sell Set line. The Sell Set line within the Receipt uses a similar set of buttons as per the Receipt Item Line section above but buttons act independently to the Receipt Item Line i.e., you may wish to allow the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but not on the Receipt Sell Set line. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Receipt Sell Set section. Delete Set. This will remove the entire set. Receipt Expense Adding an Expense item to the transaction creates an Expense line on the receipt. The buttons on the Expense line are similar to those on the Receipt Item Line section, but they operate independently. For instance, you might want to activate the Add Text button on the Receipt Item Line but disable it on the Receipt Expense line. To configure the Button Management settings for these buttons, access the Receipt Expense section.

title: Right Menu POS Functions
text: To set Button Management for these buttons use the Right Menu POS Functions section. Account Deposit: This button will only show when a customer is selected within the Widgets menu. Cancel Sale: Before disabling the option to Cancel Sale, careful consideration should be given as doing so would prevent the clerk from being able to lock the POS without this button. Item Group After selecting the Item Group button on the Right Menu PoS Functions you will see these buttons. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Group section. This will Cancel any action. This will reset any current actions. This will bring up a search box for you to narrow down options. This will confirm current selections. Please note that in the Right Menu POS Functions set of buttons, several buttons may appear similar but can be individually enabled or disabled. For instance, the Cancel button in Item Shortcuts has the same appearance as the Cancel button in Item Group. However, the buttons are independently controlled in Button Management by enabling or disabling the corresponding option under Item Shortcuts. Item Shortcuts The Item Shortcuts option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Cancel button on Item Group but not on Item Shortcuts. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Item Shortcuts section. Create Gift Certificate The Create Gift Certificate option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Create Gift Certificate. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Create Gift Certificate section. Sell Set The Sell Set option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Sell Set. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Sell Set section. Make Expense The Make Expense option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Make Expense. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Make Expense section. Parked Transactions The Parked Transactions option uses a similar set of buttons to Item Group, but the buttons act independently i.e., you may wish to allow the Reset button on Item Group but not on Parked Transactions. To set Button Management for these buttons use the Parked Transactions section. Individual parked transactions listed have the following buttons that can be managed. Delete. Add to Basket. Find Receipt The buttons in the Find Receipt section have names that match those assigned in Button Management. Some buttons may resemble those in the Item Group, but they operate independently. You can enable or disable buttons as needed, such as allowing the Reset button on Item Group but not on Find Receipt. To manage these buttons, go to the Find Receipt section and adjust the Button Management settings. The individual receipts listed have their own buttons that can also be managed. Reprint Last Receipt. Return. Print Gift Copy. Email Receipt Copy. Cancel. Receipt Copy/Filters - This will open a search bar with dates you can search. Search for specific dates of a receipt. Show More Results.

title: Aside Menu
text: The Aside Menu can be opened by clicking on the Show Aside menu button located in the Header. The buttons within the Aside Menu are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Aside Menu section. X Report The buttons in the X Report are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, access the X Report section and use the Button Management feature. Picklist Report The buttons in the Picklist Report are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Picklist Report section and utilize the Button Management functionality. Cash Statement The buttons in the Cash Statement section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, go to the Cash Statement section and access the Button Management feature. Morning Amount The buttons in the Morning Amount section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To adjust the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Morning Amount section and utilize the Button Management functionality. Card Terminal Actions The buttons in the Card Terminal Actions section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, go to the Card Terminal Actions section and use the Button Management feature. The Terminal Actions menu can be accessed from within the Card Terminal Actions. Journals The buttons in the Journals section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, access the Journals section and use the Button Management feature.

title: Payment
text: Payment The buttons in the Payment section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To adjust the settings for these buttons, go to the Payment section and utilize the Button Management feature. Please note that both Quick Cash and Quick Card have similar-looking buttons that also appear in the Receipt section. To manage them, you must independently configure their settings in the Receipt section. Right Menu Payment The buttons in the Right Menu Payment section are labeled to correspond with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure the settings for these buttons, navigate to the Right Menu Payment section and utilize the Button Management feature. Please note that the Loyalty Bonus button will only appear when the Loyalty module is in use and a registered customer has enough points to redeem. Similarly, the Account button will only be visible when a customer with a creditworthy account is selected.

title: Terminal Actions
text: The functions here are dependent on your card provider.

title: Button Management
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible Button Management, in conjunction with Clerk Roles, allows you to manage the enabled or disabled state of a button for a group of clerks. In the POS Admin section, Button Management enables you to control access to specific POS functions at the shop level. On the other hand, Clerk Roles allow you to control access to POS functions for groups of clerks. Please note that Clerk Roles take precedence over Button Management settings. If a clerk does not have a role set, the button's state will be determined by the settings configured in Button Management. In both Button Management and Clerk Roles, many buttons are labelled with text. In such cases, the button option to enable or disable will correspond to the button label shown on the POS. However, if a button is displayed with an icon only on the POS, this documentation will provide a representation of the button and its location to help you navigate to the correct option. The POS layout consists of different sections, and understanding these key areas will aid you in selecting the appropriate button to manage: 1. Header: This section displays notifications, date, time, and store/clerk information. 2. Receipt: Here, you interact with items for sales and perform other functions within the POS. 3. The Receipt Item Line: This refers specifically to the Receipt screen when you have added an item to the POS, excluding Item Group, Expense, Gift Certificate, Account Deposit, or Set. 4. Widgets: The functionality of Widgets can be enabled or disabled by your K3 representative, account manager, or support staff. 5. Right Menu POS Function: This section allows you to interact with day-to-day functions within the POS that are not directly related to finding items in the database.

title: Aside Menu
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. TABLE OF CONTENTS X Report: Picklist Report: Cash Statement: Morning Amount: Card Terminal Actions: Journals: The Aside Menu can be accessed by clicking the "Show Aside Menu" button in the Header. Within the Aside Menu, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles given in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Aside Menu section. X Report: In the X Report section, the buttons are named to match the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, go to the X Report section. Picklist Report: Within the Picklist Report section, the buttons are labeled according to the titles defined in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Picklist Report section. Cash Statement: In the Cash Statement section, the buttons are named to align with the titles assigned in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, refer to the Cash Statement section. Morning Amount: Within the Morning Amount section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles given in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Morning Amount section. Card Terminal Actions: In the Card Terminal Actions section, the buttons are named to match the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Card Terminal Actions section. The Terminal Actions menu can be accessed from within the Card Terminal Actions menu. Journals: Within the Journals section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles defined in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, refer to the Journals section.

title: Payment
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. Payment: In the Payment section, the buttons are named to match the titles provided in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, access the Payment section. However, please note that both the Quick Cash and Quick Card buttons have a similar appearance and appear in the Receipt section as well. Therefore, they need to be managed independently in both sections. Right Menu Payment: Within the Right Menu Payment section, the buttons are labeled to correspond with the titles specified in Button Management. To configure Button Management for these buttons, navigate to the Right Menu Payment section. Please note the following: - The Loyalty Bonus button will only appear if the Loyalty module is in use and a registered customer has accumulated enough points to redeem. - The Account button will only appear when a customer with a creditworthy account is selected.

title: Terminal Actions
text: The PoS Admin - Button Management menu should be used in preference to this menu, Admin will be removed in future releases and will not be accessible. The functions here are dependant on your card provider.

title: Step 1 - Create a New Stocktake (Full)
text: Step 1: Select "Create New." This will open a new page. Step 2: Provide a suitable description for the Stocktake. Step 3: From the stocktake type drop-down, select "Full." Step 4: Choose a shop from the shop drop-down. Step 5: Click "Save" to create your new Full stocktake. Step 6: Wait for a few moments. Afterward, you will be redirected to the newly created Stocktake form. Step 7: Start counting your stock from this page.

title: Step 2 - Count Add Items to Stocktake
text: Step 1: Select "Count." This opens a counting page where you can manually add items or import a count from a file. (For file import, refer to the separate section on File Import.) Step 2: Enter the Physical Section You Are Currently Counting. You can choose to add your counts in individual sections, such as Stockroom, gondolas/stands, display windows, cupboards, etc. This allows you to break down the count according to your shop's structure. If you are importing, the sections may be defined by the import file. You can select and modify individual count lists later before completing the stocktake. If left blank, all counts will be listed under the Default section in the Count drop-down list. Step 3: Enter the Barcode. You can scan or manually enter a barcode into the barcode box to search for an item. When selected, a default quantity of 1 is added. Step 4: Use Find Item Manually. You can search for an item manually using various options: Search Text: Find the item based on a whole word or use " before or after the word to search for all possibilities (e.g., "can" for candles or "*proof" for waterproof). Vendor: Use the drop-down to select one or more vendors from the list. Item Groups: Use the drop-down to select one or more item groups from the list. Search: Initiate the search process and display all results in the list below. Note: The steps mentioned above are part of the process when you are on the counting page, allowing you to add items manually or search for items using barcodes or manual search options.

title: Step 3 - Manual Count
text: Step 1: If you are counting by sections, enter a description in the physical section box. Step 2: Scan or key in a barcode or use the Find Item Manually option to alter count quantities. Each scan of the barcode increases the quantity by 1. The most recent scanned item is displayed in the Last Scanned item box. You can manually adjust the quantity here instead of in the Manual Count list before moving to the next item. Step 3: If adding items directly from the item list, adjust count quantities using the Plus and Minus buttons or by selecting the quantity field. The quantity is limited to a maximum value of 10 digits (e.g., 9999999999) with up to 2 decimal places (e.g., 99999999.99). The minimum value is 0. Step 4: Use the items by page [5 10 20 50 100] and the page number [1 of 3362 (3362 items)] to scroll through and find more items. Step 5: When all counts are added, choose the Back button to close the count page. All counts are automatically saved. If you entered a description into the Physical section box, it will appear in the Count list. Use the drop-down to see all Counts. Step 6: To add more individual counts, choose Count again from the top right-hand side and add a different physical description. Step 7: To amend a specific location, such as Location 55, choose Count again from the top right-hand side and type in the same description again. It MUST be the same description; otherwise, it will show under a new count location. Step 8: Repeat the Count process until all items to be counted are added.

title: Step 4 - Calculate / Recount
text: Step 1: From the Count screen, choose "Calculate." Step 2: Wait for the calculation process to complete. It may take some time, especially for a full stock calculation. Avoid changing stock quantities while the calculation is in progress. Once finished, the status will change to "Calculated." Step 3: Click on a calculated stocktake to view the results. Step 4: In the header section, you'll see a summary of the calculation, including Expected, Counted, and Variance for Quantity, Cost, and Price. The item list provides more detailed quantity figures. Step 5: Review the discrepancy report to identify any differences between the counted and expected figures. The report can be sorted from highest to lowest or vice versa for easier identification. By default, only items with discrepancies are shown. To view all items, including those without discrepancies, toggle the option off. Step 6: If needed, export the Discrepancy list to Excel using the XLSX button. Step 7: If you need to make changes and adjust quantities, choose "Recount." Step 8: Confirm the recount by selecting "Yes." Choosing "No" or "Cancel" will cancel the recount request. Step 9: The system will take you back to the counting section, where you can adjust quantities as required. Once done, choose "Calculate" again. Step 10: You can repeat the recount process as many times as needed until you are ready to commit the final counts. × Close

title: Step 5 - Commit
text: Step 1: Review the discrepancy report. Step 2: If everything is correct, choose "Commit" to accept the discrepancy report and update the stock figures. Step 3: A prompt will appear asking you to confirm the commitment. Select "Yes, Commit" to proceed with the Commit request. Step 4: The stocktake list will show "Committing" while making the final adjustments. Once completed, it will show "Closed." Step 5: You can view the closed stocktake again by clicking on the closed stocktake in the list. Note: The steps mentioned above involve accepting the discrepancy report and updating the stock figures by committing the changes.

title: Clerks
text: This is where you manage which Clerks have access to the POS in a particular store or globally. You can make modifications to your list of clerks or you can use the Add Clerk button to create a new one. Use the toggle to ‘Show inactive clerks’. Clerk Number This must be a unique combination of numbers & letters that the Clerk will use to sign into the POS. Password This can be a combination of letters & numbers (special characters are excluded for ease of use and compatibility). *Clerk passwords should be secure but not too complex that it will cause issues. First Name First name of the Clerk. Last Name Last name of the Clerk. Phone Number Clerk Phone Number (Not used within the system. For reference purposes only). Email Clerk Email address (Not used within the system. For reference purposes only). Job Title The clerks job title within the company. Language The language used in the POS when this Clerk signs in. Manager This is linked to security options that the Clerk has. Local Shop Clerk Whether the Clerk is limited to 1 local shop or global. Shops Select the local shops for that clerk if 'Local Shop Clerk' is selected. Active It is possible to make Clerks inactive by deselecting this option. This may be preferable to deleting clerks.

title: Clerk Roles
text: Clerk Roles provide a means of organizing clerks into groups based on their permissions. This streamlines the process of assigning permissions to new clerks, making it faster and more efficient. Each role is associated with a Button Management profile, which controls the POS buttons that are available to all clerks belonging to that role. You have the flexibility to create as many different roles as you need. Using the drop-down menus, select which POS buttons will be available to clerks when assigned to the clerk role.

title: Expenses
text: On the Expenses page, you can input, modify, or remove expense information. Expense codes on this page are utilized through the POS system to track any expenses paid directly from the cash drawer. This could include payments for services such as window cleaning or purchasing cleaning supplies. Creating an Expense On the Expenses page, you will see your current expenses listed. To begin making a new Expense use the "Add Expense" button, this will take you to a new page. After completing the form, select the "Save" button. Once the form has been saved, a notification will display to confirm the successful save. Please keep in mind that after creating your expenses, you will need to link them to a group for them to be accessible through the POS system. This can be accomplished using the Groups module. When utilizing the Expenses feature via the POS, the expenses will be arranged in alphabetical order and identified by their assigned number. Additional information can be found in the Make Expense section. Number The code should consist of numbers only, with a maximum of four digits, and each code must be unique. Please note that expenses can have the same name, but they cannot have the same code. If you attempt to assign a code that is already in use, you will receive an error message stating "Expense number already exists." Name* Give your Expense a name so that it can be identified at the POS. This is limited to no more than 50 characters. Tax Tax assigned to the specific Expense. Editing an Expense To modify an expense, simply choose the expense you wish to change. This action will prompt the Expenses window to appear. Cancel Button: This will return you to the list of expenses. Delete Button: Once you initiate the process of removing an expense, you will be prompted to confirm the deletion. After confirmation, you will receive a notification indicating that the expense has been successfully deleted. Save Button: Use this to keep any changes that you make.

title: Credit Memo
text: Within the backoffice, you can view your outstanding Credit Memos in each of the system currencies currently being used. The upper portion displays the aggregate value of your unpaid debts. You can utilize the available filters to refine your results. Moreover, you have the option to expire a particular or all vouchers listed in the filter. To conduct further analysis, you can export the list as a CSV file by utilizing the 'Download to CSV' feature.

title: Reason Codes
text: In this section, you can oversee and revise your Reason Codes. These codes are utilized to identify particular actions on the POS and can aid in future reporting. If you intend to modify a reason code, select the pencil icon, which will trigger a box to appear at the bottom of the page. To add a new Reason Code click ''Add Reason Code" and a box will appear at the bottom of the page. Ensure when you have finished amending or creating your new Code press ''Save Reason Code". Code User-defined numerical code, a maximum of 20 numbers long. Avoid using a number already in use. Description User-defined User-defined User-defined alpha-numerical code, maximum of 50 characters long. Descriptions for Discount type reason codes are printed on the receipt. Reason Type Option for Discount, Return or Other. Discount reason codes will show when you apply a discount at the POS. Return reason codes will show when you chose to return an item(s) on the POS. Other is an arbitrary type, including stock edits. Reason Scope You have the option of how the Reason code is shown by Line, Receipt or Receipt and Line. Line (when applied to discount reason codes) – will show discount reason codes at line level i.e. when you apply a discount for a single item. Line (when applied to return reason codes) - will show return reason codes for items you scan or search for at the POS. Receipt (when applied to discount reason codes) – will show discount reason codes at the transaction level i.e. when you apply a discount for all items (generally this is done via the POS Total line) Receipt (when applied to return reason codes) - will show for items you return via the receipt, either by scanning the receipt barcode or looking up the receipt via the Find Receipt button Receipt and Line (when applied to any reason code) - will show via both the Line and Receipt methods for your discount or return. Active Whether the Reason code is active or not. This option is only shown after a reason code is Saved (by default all new reason codes are initially Active). Inactive Reason Codes are not available at the POS. Offline This option shows for Return Reason Types only and allows the clerk to say whether the item is in a condition to be sold or not. Items that cannot go back to the shop floor should be marked as Offline.

title: Payment Types
text: In the POS configuration section, you can customize the list of available "Payment Types" to suit your needs. This table displays the default payment types provided by Imagine, along with any custom payment types you have created. To modify the order of the payment types, simply drag and drop them to your preferred location. Remember to save your changes to ensure they are applied. It's important to note that any changes made to the payment type order will be reflected in the POS layout during usage. Please keep in mind that certain attributes of default payment types, such as their name, image URL, or payment strategy, cannot be altered. Is active in the POS This feature manages the activation status of payment types in the POS. By switching the toggle, you can effortlessly activate or deactivate a payment option. If disabled, the payment type will be entirely removed from the POS, in contrast to other buttons that may only become unavailable. Should be reconciled This setting determines which payment types must be accounted for and documented in the 'Cash Statement' at the end of the day. You can control this by enabling or disabling each payment type as needed. Opens the drawer when used. This enables/disables ‘cash drawer’ functionality at the POS for the selected payment type. Additional Notes Card To makes the Card payment type visible on the payment list of the POS, you must choose the "Is active in the POS" option and activate an integrated card solution. This feature can be accessed through the "Manage K3 Connector" menu in the 'Admin' module. If an integrated card solution has not been activated, the Card payment type will remain hidden from the payment list on the POS. Account To configures the Account payment type, use the 'Payment Types' settings like any other payment method. However, it will only appear on the POS if the 'Customer' widget has been enabled. For additional information, refer to the POS widgets section. Currency In contrast to other payment methods that can be configured through the 'Payment Types' settings, the Foreign Currency payment method is constantly displayed on the payment list in the POS. Nevertheless, it can only be activated once a foreign currency has been included in the Shop Setup section of the Admin module. Loyalty Bonus This payment method is not configured through the 'Payment Types' settings. It will only be displayed on the POS when a customer is selected who has earned loyalty points. For further information on how Loyalty works, please see the Loyalty section. Custom Payment Types If you require a payment option that is not on the list of default options then you can add a new payment type. To add a new Payment Type press the + Symbol, this will add an empty line to the list. Payment Type Name This will be displayed on the POS and receipts. Is active in the POS Check this box for the payment type to be active in the POS. Should be reconciled Check this box if the payment type is to be counted and recorded on the end-of-day cash statement. Icon URL Images can be assigned to custom payment types only. These are displayed on the POS payment buttons. A URL address for the image is required. Payment Strategy This determines how the custom Payment type will function Default Functions like a cash sale. Default Card functions Functions like a card sale. Default Foreign Voucher functions Functions like a foreign Gift Certificate. Ensure you press Save to keep your new payment type.

title: Taxes in Back Office
text: Tax Groups are a collection of tax rates that are applied to specific products or services. These tax rates are determined by factors such as the product category, country, region, or state where the transaction takes place. In a point-of-sale (POS) system, taxes are grouped to identify the tax owed on a sale of an item in a particular location. By assigning a tax group to a product or service, the system can quickly determine the appropriate tax rate to apply to the transaction. Tax Groups can be configured to support different tax scenarios, such as varying tax rates for different regions, or tax exemptions for certain products or services. Effective management of tax groups can help ensure accurate tax reporting, minimise errors, and streamline the sales process. Tax Codes are the individual taxes within a Group, such as Standard rate, Reduced rate, Zero rate etc. These can be timed to come in to effect if needed. Within the Taxes area you can make modifications to your existing Tax Groups and Codes, and you can create new Tax Groups and Codes to suit your business needs. Tax Groups Allows for the creation of new Tax Groups through the Add Tax Group button. The Search bar will allow you to search on the Tax Group Name or Number of Tax Codes to allow for easy identification of the existing Tax Group. Add Tax Group Click the Add Tax Group button to add a new group. Tax Group Name Identify the tax group by name, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Can be a maximum of 50 characters. This is the name you use to identify the Tax Group in other areas of Imagine. This name must be unique across your list of Tax Groups Tax Code Name Identify the tax code by name, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Can be a maximum of 50 characters. Additional tax codes can be added after the initial creation. See the "modifying tax groups" section below. . This is the name you use to identify the Tax Code in other areas of Imagine Percent A decimal number, up to two decimal places that is zero or greater. This Percent is the default percentage and is used to calculate tax liability, therefore must be accurate. Once created additional tax code percentage can be added along with "valid from" times After the initial creation you will be given the opportunity to add additional tax codes. When you are finished you should use the Back button to complete and save your changes. See the "modifying tax groups" section below. Overview Lists all your existing Tax Groups and the number of tax codes associated with that group. Tax Group Name As given in the Tax Group Name when creating or editing a Tax Group Number of Tax Groups The number of tax codes associated with the group Modifying Tax Groups and Tax Codes To modify a Tax Group, click on the individual tax group name, and you will be directed to the Tax Group page. Here you can edit the Tax Group Name as well as create new and edit existing tax rates. Note: when editing the Tax Group Name, remember this name must be unique across your list of Tax group Names. You must click the save icon for name changes to complete When you have completed editing your tax codes click the Back button to return to the overview screen To delete the entire Tax Group, use the Delete button, and then click on the orange banner to confirm the action. This action cannot be undone Use the + button to add a new tax code or tax percentage Use the edit icon to alter the name of the tax rate Use the save icon to save changes Use the cancel icon to discard any changes you have made Use the delete icon to remove completely the tax rate Name Name of the tax code, can be letters, numbers or special characters up to 30 characters in length. The Tax Group Name must be unique. when compared to other Tax Group Names in your list Default Percentage Tax Code percentage, as a decimal number, up to two decimal places. This percentage you cannot remove individually and will be the 'default' value where another percentage is not valid. Tax Percentage The tax percentage. as a decimal number, up to two decimal places. Valid From A date from which this percentage comes in to use. This could be for a temporary tax change or to implement a tax change outside of office hours. The "default" percentage does not have this function. Any percentage that is valid by the given date will continue to be valid until it is superseded by a new value or deleted.
