The Valid From date is inclusive, that is it comes into force at 00:00:01 on the date selected Note: tax codes ensure, when a transaction is completed in a shop, that the correct tax percentage due for that item is recorded. In order to do this there are several other areas to consider when setting up taxes Each Shop must have a Tax Group assigned. Shops must know for each given item, whether they can apply to the item a corresponding Tax Code inline with the shops Tax Group (and thus what tax percentage they should apply to the transaction). Without this information a shop cannot sell the item. Knowing this can be via the Primary Group, the Group or the Tax Group assigned in Shop Configuration. It is possible to have tax groups assigned in all of these areas, so Imagine will check firstly in the Primary Group, then in the Groups (in order of the listed Groups), and finally in the Shop Configuration - Tax Group for the Tax Code to apply. It is not possible to create or edit a shop so that it does not have a Tax Group configured Each item can be assigned a Tax Code from each Tax Group. Each shop will then be able to list items for sale where the shops Tax Group matches the items Tax Code Item Hierarchies require a Tax Code per Tax Group in a similar fashion to Items. This allows for collecting the correct tax on Item Group sales

title: Groups
text: The Groups module enables you to group shops. By adding shops to a group, they will adopt the settings applied to that particular group, such as Reason Codes, Expenses, Tax Codes, and Item Groups. As a result, only the selected options for that group will appear in the POS. You can create an unlimited number of groups, but it is mandatory to select a group in Shops, so you must create at least one group. However, the options within the groups are not compulsory. To create a new group click ''ADD GROUP'' and a new page will open. The Options will apply to any shop with this group selected, meaning Tax Group Code, Reason Code, Expenses and Item Hierarchy selections will effect what options are available at the PoS. For example, if a group uses Tax codes FR and UK, a shop which trades in GBP will automatically use the UK tax codes. Tax Group Code: will determine the tax code applied to a shop Reason Codes: when applied to the shop, only the listed reason Codes will be available at the PoS Expenses: when applied to the shop, only the listed Expenses will be available at the PoS Item Hierarchy: when applied to shop the Item Hierarchy selection affects which Item Groups can be used on the PoS for miscellaneous sales. Note that this is also effected by the Tax Rates applied to the individual Hierarchy Node To amend or delete a Group click on the name and it will open a new page. When you have made the amends ensure you press save or delete to remove the group.

title: Gift Vouchers
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Sum of Outstanding Balances of Each Summary Table Filters Gift Voucher Details Expiring a Gift Voucher Download as CSV The Gift Voucher module provides an overview of all outstanding gift vouchers in each of your system's currencies. You can utilize this section to break down the gift vouchers into individual ones and filter them by their status. Additionally, you can choose to display only the expired gift vouchers if needed. Sum of Outstanding Balances of Each Summary In this section, you can view the total sum of your outstanding liabilities, which are displayed per currency (if applicable). If a gift voucher has not been issued for a specific currency, it will not be shown in this section. The values for each currency are calculated when the page is initially loaded, and the date and time of this calculation are provided. If you suspect that the totals have been updated since the page was loaded, you can use the Refresh button to recalculate the sum. Table Filters You can use the provided filters to narrow down your lists. Use the From and To filters to narrow down the date range. The dates are inclusive of the dates set. The Show drop-down will give you a list of status of the gift vouchers. The following table details the Status and their meanings. Use the Show drop-down to see a set of gift vouchers with a specific Status Status Meaning All Gift Vouchers with any status as listed here. Open Gift Voucher's that have been issued from the POS and also have a Current Amount greater than 0. Redeemed Once a gift voucher's Current Amount has reached 0, there is no longer any liability associated with it. Expired If a gift voucher's Current Amount is greater than 0 but its liability has been removed from the system (i.e., expired) before it could be utilized, the gift voucher will no longer be valid for use. Issued List's all gift vouchers irrespective of status. Transactions List all actions for Gift Vouchers. After setting all the desired filters, click on the Apply button to refine the search. If you wish to revert to the default filter settings, you can use the Reset button. By default, the filters are set to display all open gift vouchers for all stores up to and including today's date. Gift Voucher Details The displayed gift vouchers may vary depending on the selected filters. You can further narrow down the list by using the "Search by Voucher Number" box if you know either the full or partial voucher number. Expiring a Gift Voucher Gift Vouchers can be either manually expired here or may be automatically expired through the settings in Gift Voucher Setup. You can choose to manually expire a gift voucher that has a current amount either individually or as a group. To expire an individual voucher, make sure that its status is "Open" and that it has a current amount greater than 0. Then, use the "Expire" button on the same line as the voucher to expire it. You will be asked to confirm this action before proceeding. If you wish to expire all outstanding vouchers, you can do so by clicking on the "Expire All" button. Please note that redeemed vouchers cannot be expired since their liability has already been fulfilled. There is no need to expire redeemed vouchers. At the PoS to use a voucher it must not have a status of Expired and must have an Expired Date in the future. Vouchers that have an Expired Date in the past do not automatically have their status updated to Expired here, as it is valid to have a Gift Voucher as both Open and with an expiry date in the past. Download as CSV You can export the list to a CSV file for further analysis. Follow the instructions given are pressing the Download as CSV button.

title: Data Export
text: The data export utility is a generic tool for exporting Imagine retail data. While it was primarily developed to meet Germany's fiscal compliance requirements, it generates a zip file that includes a .dtd file and CSV files that represent the data in the Imagine database. Any example use-case might be if you want to download a file with all of your products, their item numbers, and their barcodes. The data tree provides a catalogue of tables in the database. To see the available options, simply click the "+" icon to expand the selection. You can then select which filters you wish to include within the Data Export. NOTE: Some filters will have additional options when selected along with a toggle to enable if required. If you toggle a specific field, you can opt to filter the data based on a value you provide. Once you have chosen the data you wish to export for all pertinent tables, click the Start Export button located at the top. After initiating the data export task, it may take a while to complete, depending on the amount of data you have chosen to export. If it is taking longer than expected, keep checking back, as it will continue to process in the background. Once it is ready, you will receive an email containing a download link. Upon completion, you will see a download button, which you can use to access your exported data. Please note that downloads are only available for two days.

title: Mobile Pay
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Configuration Add POS Create a QR Code Mobile Pay is a payment system based on a phone application used in Denmark. Imagine has integrated Mobile Pay into its system, allowing customers to scan a unique QR code at the point of sale to view the transaction total and authorize payment. For further details about the customer mobile app, please visit https://www.mobilepay.dk/ Configuration Before configuring each POS and Shop for Mobile Pay, several tenant-level settings must be configured. Firstly, you must enter the merchant brand ID. If this has not been entered, the system will display the following message. Click on Settings and enter your merchant ID and click Save. Once the Merchant Brand ID is set the Add POS button will be enabled. Add POS Clicking add POS will display the following screen. Shop* Select from the drop-down which shops you are adding the POS too. Connector* Select which connector you wish to use. Merchant Location ID* Enter the Merchant Location ID provided by Mobile Pay for this shop and click on "Lookup Store". It is important to note that the company number for this store must match the one provided by Mobile Pay. Beacon ID / Type The Beacon ID is a 12-digit number that serves to uniquely identify this POS among all Mobile Pay merchants. Enter the ID, which should contain 12 digits, and select both QR Code Beacon and Bluetooth Beacon options. Create a QR Code You can create a QR Code using any QR Code creator, but the content must follow the below format. Make sure to replace 123456789012 with your beacon ID. mobilepaypos://pos?id=123456789012&source=qr The below example was created at https://www.the-qrcode-generator.com/

title: Fiskaly
text: Fiskaly is a cloud-based fiscalization platform that offers compliance solutions for businesses operating in various industries. It is designed to help businesses meet tax compliance regulations and protect themselves against fiscal fraud. Fiskaly provides a range of services, including hardware security modules, a point of sale app, and APIs for integrating with other software applications. The platform is mainly used in Europe, particularly in Germany and Austria, where fiscal compliance regulations are strict and require businesses to use certified systems to manage their financial transactions.

title: Item Info
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS There are several examples of how Item Info can be used, such as: Examples of gathering information to gain insights about your customers or sales include: Item Info overview Adding Item Info Linking an Item Info to an Item The Item Info feature is used to include supplementary details about an item at the point of sale or to collect further information regarding the purchase of the item. There are several examples of how Item Info can be used, such as: Assisting the clerk in providing more detailed information about items to the customer. Reminding the clerk about up-selling or cross-selling opportunities. Providing advice to the customer about the item they are purchasing. Verifying the customer's age. Examples of gathering information to gain insights about your customers or sales include: The Item Info feature can also be used to: Request the customer's permission to receive promotional material via email from the business. Collect anonymous and non-intrusive demographic information about the customer base, such as gender, age range, and whether the customer is shopping alone or in a group. Furthermore, the data captured through Item Info can be associated with the transaction (either at the header or detail level) and stored for reporting purposes in the future. Item Info overview After clicking on Item Info you will be presented with a list of already created Item Info. Add Item Info Clicking on the "Add Item Info" button will lead the user to the screen where they can create new Item Info. Edit Button This enables editing of any previously created Item Info. Delete Button This allows deleting an Item Info. NOTE: Item Info should only be deleted when it is no longer in use. Active Check Box This feature enables the user to mark an Item Info as active or inactive by assigning a tick and then saving the changes. By default, newly created Item info is active. It is recommended not to delete an Item's Info until it has been marked as inactive. Prompt Every This is the point where the prompt will be displayed to the cashier. Adding Item Info Description Displays the description for any Item Info that has been created Info Type Displays the type of information for any created Item Info, which can be either Info or Question. Prompt Every Shows the selected prompt frequency for any created Item info on the POS, which can be Line or Transaction. Transaction: The message or question should only be presented once during a transaction when the same item is scanned. For example, if I purchase three identical items, I would prefer the clerk to suggest batteries only once, rather than repeating the suggestion three times. Line: The message or question should be displayed every time an item is scanned. This is necessary because we may need to collect information or send a message about each item line, such as in the case of a sale of a pair of shoes where we need to confirm a matching pair. Remember to click "Save" when finished or "Back" to cancel any changes. Display Text This is the prompt/message text which will be displayed on the POS Custom Item Attribute The drop-down menu allows selecting the Custom Item Attributes that will activate the Item Info prompt at the POS. Please note that only Yes/No type Custom Attributes will appear in the drop-down list as they are the ones that link the item to the Item Info. Question Choices This field will only be displayed when the Info Type is set to Question. Here, the user can enter the options that the clerk can choose from, such as "Yes," "No," or "Maybe." Each choice should be saved by hitting Enter between them. All other required fields should be completed as needed. Linking an Item Info to an Item After creating and saving the Item Info, you must link it to an item. As previously mentioned, the Item Info must be linked to a Custom Attribute. The Custom Attributes Tab page provides instructions on how to link a Custom Attribute to an item. Once linked and the item is added to the transaction screen in the POS, the Item Info will be displayed.

title: Welcome to the K3 Imagine Documentation
text: The Imagine documentation is here to help you, so please browse or search the articles (from the home page or the box highlighted below, and send us feedback if you think something could be improved or added (or if you like something).

title: Glossary
text: This is a non-exhaustive list of acronyms and words used throughout the documentation, along with their meanings. Tenant: Refers to a customer, a system, or a unique instance of an application known as a "tenant." User: A login used by an individual associated with a specific tenant. Module: An application or set of functionalities within Imagine. Modules must be enabled for a tenant, and users can be granted permission to access specific modules. Clerk: A user with access only to the Point of Sale (POS) system. Front Of Store: TOP (Table Order and Pay): An application that allows customers to arrive at a location, scan a QR code/NFC tag, place an order for goods to be delivered to their table, and pay for it on their device using their credit/debit cards. POP (Popup, Order and Pay): An application for stores that offer pop-up remote ordering of goods for collection or home delivery. Customers can pay for their orders with their own credit/debit cards on their own devices. Kiosk: An application designed for stand-up shared points in a location, enabling customers to select and order goods for later collection. Payments are made using a traditional retail Pin Entry Device. SCO (Self Checkout): An application designed for pre-packaged retail products. Customers can scan or look up items, similar to a convenience store, and pay using a credit/debit card on a traditional Pin Entry Device. Simple POS: An application for clerks to serve customers using a lightweight POS system with discount and refund functions. Simple POS accepts cash and card payments, and items can be scanned into the system through button-driven menus. ORB (Order Ready Board): Orders placed through POP, TOP, or Kiosk can be processed using the Order Status Display (OSD). The ORB displays orders in progress and moves them to the relevant column when ready for collection. Back Of Store: OSD (Order Status Display): Used for order processing, allowing orders to be moved from "Pending" to "In Progress" and "Ready." These status changes are reflected in the ORB. SCO Companion: A companion app to SCO, allowing for remote monitoring and approval of restricted items, eliminating the need for colleagues to physically approach the unit for approvals, among other functions. Back Office: Product Configurator: A tool to configure items, bundles, bundle groups, and modifier groups. These elements play different roles in various SelfServe applications within Imagine. Understanding their purpose and usage is essential for SelfServe apps. Visual Composer: An application for configuring Composer Groups, which are tiles used for navigation and selection in SelfServe apps. It also allows control over the theming of front-end applications. These configurations can be applied on a per-app, per-location basis. Self-Serve Admin: A configuration interface for Self-Serve apps, including TOP and POP URLs, Time Slots, Shop Policies, and Payment Providers. These options are set based on a per-location, per-app basis. PPE (Price and Promotion Engine): A unique tool for retailers that accumulates real-time market data. It helps retailers instantly adjust prices for each shopper based on customer behaviour, purchasing power, and the actions of competitors. UOM (Units of Measure): Used to quantify inventory items and enable tracking. It represents a physical unit of measurement, such as kg, dozen, meter, etc.

title: Imagine Documentation Language
text: The Imagine documentation is in English which is a common first or second language for our global customer base.

title: Release Notes
text: K3 Imagine Release Notes (including pre-release details) can be found on the K3 Imagine Release Notes page.

title: Status Page
text: From this page you can view the current status of the Imagine Platform and its services @status.k3imagine.com Get updates will have options for you to subscribe to Email, Webhook or RSS feed updates. The status can also be checked within the portal and from the 3-dot menu in the Retail POS.

title: Sale
text: When making a sale, you should first scan or search for the items you want to sell. You can scan and search for as many items to sell as required and add them to the transaction. These are added as a list and the subtotal information appears at the bottom. When you have added all the lines for the transaction, you then need to take payment. The bottom section gives you some options (These options may vary from retailer to retailer) For more information see the Payments section. Cost By Location After every transaction, whether a Sale or Refund, the cost of the item at the time of the transaction is recorded. This provides an accurate profit margin as cost change over time and across regions. More details on this are in Inventory - Item List.

title: Return an Item
text: To return a line, you scan/search for the item you want to return so it is added to the transaction screen. Press the Return button on the line you are returning Optionally a list of reason codes appears on the left-hand side if these have been set up. Reason Codes are configurable in the Back Office. You will then see the price is negated, as is the quantity box. You can then use the Payment buttons to issue the refund.

title: Exchange an Item
text: You will find a combination of Sale lines and Return lines in an exchange transaction. To initiate the exchange, scan or search the items and press enter. Select the appropriate reason for the return. If the replacement item is of the same price, scan it to complete the transaction seamlessly. The subtotal will display the net balance remaining for the transaction. You can utilize the Payment functions to finalize the transaction. The cash register will prompt you for the additional payment if there is a price difference.

title: Return from a Receipt
text: Return from Scanned Receipt The POS will detect when a receipt is scanned into the main transaction screen. When scanned, it loads the return item selection screen showing items for that receipt. The receipt barcode should be enabled in Admin - Receipt Setup. NOTE: It is only possible to return the item(s) quantity that was sold on the original receipt. NOTE: It is not possible to scan a receipt whilst other items are already on the transaction screen. If you want to scan a receipt for return ensure this is done before any other items are added to the transaction. Any local discount applied to the original item will be applied to the return but the discount will not be applied to any exchange items automatically. Manually Find Receipt To return items from the receipt select Find Receipt from the side menu. Locate the receipt to be returned using the date and receipt number filters. Receipts will be listed from the most recent at the top of the list down through to the earliest with a page of 100 returned at a time. Use the Show More Results button to retrieve further receipts. Once the relevant receipt has been located click on it to show more options From the bottom of the selected receipt choose the Return function. All items on this transaction will be displayed with the option to select the items and quantities to return. If return Reason Codes are enabled then a Reason for each row must also be selected. Note: Items sold as Item Group sales are shown as the Hierarchy name associated with the Item Group button. An EAN will not be shown for these items. Once all items are to be returned a selected, click OK. The selected items will be loaded onto the transaction screen as a return.

title: Line Discount
text: It's possible to assign a discount to a line on the transaction. Note: If a discount cannot be applied to the item at the PoS it may have been prevented in the Inventory module using the PoS Block Discount option. See Miscellaneous Tab for more details. Note: It is not possible to apply a discount to a Gift Certificate at the PoS, irrespective of the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab Select the line to be discounted on your PoS and the blue bar will display underneath. This gives you the configured discount options you have enabled previously in PoS Options. To remove an exact monetary amount from the line as an absolute value. Entering 10 will represent discounting by 10 pounds (this will change depending on what currency you have set up). This will apply a percentage discount to the line. For example, entering 10 here will reduce the line by 10%. When you press either of these buttons the soft keyboard will appear, enter the value of discount required. You can also have configurable Discount Hotkeys. These can quickly apply a 10% or 20% discount (see POS Discount Buttons for more details) to the line with no further entry required. If you have reason codes set up these will appear in the left-hand menu. Click the type of reason, this will then display in the line info. You can apply for discounts as many times as you like. The discount is applied to the current discounted price, but the discount % it displays will always be relative to the original item price So on a £100 item, if you press 10% discount, it will take the price to £90. Pressing the 10% discount again will take £9 off because 10% of 90 is 9. The price will then be £81. The discount displayed will be 19% rather than 20%. You can remove any applied Discount by pressing the bin icon on the discount section of the transaction line. If any Receipt/Transaction Discounts are applied these must be removed from the Subtotal bar.

title: Line Price
text: Modifying the line price for any transaction is possible. Note: if a discount cannot be applied to an item at the point of sale (PoS), it might have been restricted in the Inventory module by enabling the POS Block Discount option. For additional information, see the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab. Note: It is not possible to apply a discount to a Gift Certificate at the PoS, irrespective of the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab. When you reduce the line price, it will be treated as a discount. Conversely, increasing the line price is considered a price override. To make changes to the line price, click on the Price section of the specific line you wish to modify. Please enter the new line price, keeping in mind that whatever value you input will be considered the total price for the line. This total price will be divided equally among the quantity specified on the line. If you intend to decrease the price, it will be treated as a discount, requiring you to provide a reason code. For further details, please refer to the Discounts section. If discounting an item via an Item Label please refer to Discount Labels. You can print discount labels by amount which when scanned will override the item price.

title: Line Quantity
text: You can change the quantity of a transaction line by simply pressing the + and - buttons against the transaction line. NOTE: If a quantity change cannot be applied to the item at the POS it may have been prevented in the Inventory module using the POS Block Quantity Entry option. See Miscellaneous Tab for more details. Select the line you wish to modify so the blue bar appears. Quantity - Click to increase or decrease the line amount. When Clicked the Soft Keyboard will show. Enter the quantity required and press to confirm. Alternatively, you can press + / - to change the quantity amount. If the quantity goes below 1 the POS will assume you want to remove the item and will begin to delete.

title: Line Clerk
text: By default, all transaction lines are "sold" by the same clerk. In some instances, you may have had a different clerk responsible for the sale of one of the items. This may be required for sales targets or commission payments. Select the line you want to change the clerk for. Press the clerk button and the Soft Keyboard will appear. Enter the clerk ID of the person you want to change it to. This must be numbers only. Letters and special characters are not used in clerk ids. If the clerk ID is more than 4 numbers then the display of this number on the item will be truncated and appended with. To see the whole number click the line clerk button

title: Line Comment
text: You can add special text comments to the transaction line, such as when a product has a defect or other special condition of sale. These comments also get printed onto the receipt. Choose the line you want to add the comment to and click the. The Soft Keyboard will appear, type the comment and press to confirm. It will be reflected on the Transaction line. NOTE: You can only apply one comment to a transaction line.

title: Delete Line
text: There are two methods to delete a line from a transaction: Start by selecting the line you wish to delete. Then, click on the "Bin" icon. Alternatively, you can click on the "-" symbol to reduce the quantity of the line to zero. In both cases, you will be given a 5-second window to undo the deletion. This allows you to confirm your decision and ensure that you are satisfied with removing the line.

title: Transaction / Receipt Discount
text: You have the option to apply an overall discount to a transaction, also known as a Receipt Discount. Note: It is not possible to apply a discount to a Gift Certificate at the PoS, irrespective of the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab. There are four ways to apply a discount: Clicking the "Sub Total" bar will display the four discount options. Allows you to subtract a specific monetary value from the transaction. For example, entering 10 will apply a discount of 10 pounds. Applies a discount based on a percentage value. Entering 10 here will reduce the line by 10%. When you select either of these buttons, the soft keyboard will appear, allowing you to enter the desired discount value. Note: Although you enter a monetary value, this will convert it to a percentage before applying it across all lines in the discount. Because transaction discounts get converted to line discounts spread across the basket, this may mean rounding resulting in a few extra pence/cents discount being applied. You can also utilize configurable Discount Hotkeys. These enable you to quickly apply a predefined discount percentage, such as 10% or 20%, to the line without further input. The values for these hotkeys can be configured through K3 or the Back Office. Another method is setting a total transaction price. By clicking the "Total" box, you can enter a new total transaction value and click the confirmation button to apply the amount. If you have reason codes configured, they will appear in the Widgets Menu for selecting specific reasons associated with the discount. Note that Total Discounts are displayed and printed on the receipt to show the overall discount amount. However, in the data, the discount is allocated and stored at the Line level as if it were a Line discount. To remove or cancel a discount, click on the total amount to bring up the discount options. You will now have a delete option available; clicking it will remove the discount.

title: Payment
text: All transactions in the POS require a form of Payment to be made - even if it is a zero-value exchange. A Refund uses the same payment process but it is money out rather than money in - the functionality is the same. Quick Card will launch your defined EFT provider for the full value of the transaction. Quick Cash will pass the full value of the transaction to the cash payment and expect you to put it in the default Connector's cash drawer. If you have more than one connector configured for the Store, you will be asked which connector you want to use. Alternatively, you can use the Payment button. Pressing this will then present you with the list of payment types which have been configured for your store. Click the payment method you want to use. Payments will always assume you are paying the full/remainder of the transaction balance, however, you can pay using a mixture of different payment types, typically known as a "Split Tender". Simply overwrite the value of the payment with the amount being paid for that part payment using the soft keyboard or physical keyboard. Select either the Quick Cash or Payment options. Quick Cash - The customer has the exact amount of cash for the transaction, clicking this will complete the transaction. When Payment is selected the options will show in the left-hand column. Clicking the payment type will bring up the Soft Keyboard, and the note denominations will be shown. Upon pressing these denominations they will be added to the POS Window as a payment. NOTE: If you press return or the green arrow while the rest of the cash amount is still displayed in the box it will complete the transaction. Be sure to delete or click away from the keyboard. If a part payment type needs to be removed click that payment line and use the bin icon to remove that part payment. Card part payment removal may require a different process depending on the integration set-up. Different payment types support slightly different functionalities. Payment TypeDescription Cash For normal monetary transactions. You will be asked to key in how much money you want to pay. Card For EFT transactions, Credit or Debit. This will usually launch a separate screen which will vary between countries and EFT providers, but you will be expected to enter the value to be taken by card and then it will communicate with the card device. Account If you have a customer linked to a transaction via a widget, you can make a charge to their account. This will mean the customer owes you money to be paid later. (See Account Deposit) Currency This will allow you to accept money in differently supported currencies that have been set up for the store. The change will be issued in the native local currency. Gift Certificate You will be asked to enter the Gift Certificate number. This will only accept Gift Certificates which have been generated by the POS. Credit Note You will be asked to enter the Credit Note number. This will only accept Credit Notes which have been generated by the POS. Other These will be labelled as "Foreign" or "Manual" but also include Bank, Webshop and Mobile Payment. They have no special functionality except that they don't register cash in a drawer. They are non-integrated payment types which can be used just to say you have accepted money by another means.

title: Gift Receipt
text: You can mark a line in a transaction as a Gift Item. When marked, it will automatically print a Gift Receipt after the normal receipt, which is the same as the normal receipt but with no prices or discounts applied. They can still be returned in the normal way by scanning the receipt barcode which will know about any price changes or discounts applied. Click the Item Line and click theto add as a gift item. If you have set the option in admin to print gift labels then when choosing the gift button will also display the expiry date as shown below. Clicking the exchange date will allow you to override this on each line as applicable, note this is set in the number of days.

title: Order in Store
text: When a customer purchases an item within the store to be delivered to their home address. Add the item for delivery to the transaction. NOTE: If you try to add the item for delivery without linking to a customer you will be given a prompt. To link a customer to the Delivery use the Customer Widget to search for existing or Add a new customer. Add an item to the order if not yet added, in the item bar select the when selected this turns green. A transaction can contain both in-store orders and items purchased in-store at the time. The transaction payment is then taken in the normal way. The eCommerce provider can then get the list of orders in stores from the public API Documentation for this is found @here.

title: Start of Day
text: The Start of Day procedure in POS is called Morning Amount. The POS, you access it from the top left button. You will then be able to tap which Cash Drawer you are entering a Morning Amount for. It will list all Connectors which are configured for this store. The printer will print a slip of paper for that connector, and also pop the drawer. The POS will display all the currencies which are configured for the store. There may only be one. For each currency, you can tap the "Amount in cash drawer" box to enter the total value of money in the drawer using the Soft Keyboard For the primary currency, you can click the Expand button and it will list all the denominations of that currency. You can tap into either the Pieces box or Value box for a denomination and tap in those values. It will then automatically calculate both the other box and also the total amount. If you keep entering values and pressing the green check button, it will automatically jump you to the next denomination for the column you selected. This allows for a very quick data entry. The Total in Drawer box reflects the total value of all currencies in the drawer in local currency. Below it has multiplied the DKK value by the configured exchange rate. You can Cancel, Reset or OK (Save) the morning amounts. The printer will then print a summary of what you entered, including the foreign currency exchange calculation.

title: X Report
text: To access the X Report from the POS screen, follow these steps: Locate the Ellipsis button situated in the top right corner of the screen. Click on the Ellipsis button. Look for the X Report button and click on it. After clicking the X Report button, you will have the option to tap on the selected connector for printing purposes.

title: End of Day
text: Access the Cash Statement from the POS by clicking the Ellipsis button. Click on the Cash Statement button. Select the Cash Drawer you are entering a Morning Amount for from the listed Connectors configured for the store. The printer will print a slip of paper and open the drawer for the selected connector. The screen will display the currencies configured in the store for counting, with the primary currency listed first and additional currencies underneath. Enter the amounts for each currency in the Cash Drawer to complete the Cash Statement. You can specify amounts for Bank deposit or leave in the Drawer as an Evening Amount. Changing one value will update the other boxes. Expand the primary currency to view all denominations. Enter values in the Pieces box or Value box for each denomination, and the system will automatically calculate other boxes and the total amount. Continuing data entry will automatically move to the next denomination. The Total in Drawer box shows the total value of all currencies in the drawer in the local currency, with the DKK value multiplied by the exchange rate. The Total box indicates any variance between the physical amount and system amounts, highlighting any missing money. If a Cash Statement has already been performed that day, the system will provide a warning not to recount previously banked amounts. Choose to Cancel, Reset, or Save (OK) the Statement. Pressing OK will close the Cash Statement and print it. The Z report, which signifies the closure of the POS for the day, will be automatically printed. To reprint the last Z read, access the ellipse button and select "Print last Z read." Note that it is not possible to reprint Z reads prior to the last one. If there were issues with the original Z read, it must be reprinted before conducting another Z read. Note that sales completed using the 'default' connector will not be displayed on the Z read.

title: Item Group
text: You can sell products that aren't set up in the system or don't require stock tracking using the "Item Group" button during transactions. This feature lets you sell an item without specifying its details, which is handy for low-value items you want to clear or those without barcodes. Item Group sales allow you to track and analyze sales at a higher level, rather than individual items. The available Item Groups at the point of sale (PoS) come from the Item Hierarchy structure. Each Item Group has a tax code for accurate tax collection. However, to see an Item Group at the PoS, the store must be linked to the same Tax Group Code as the Item Hierarchy, and the store must have the Item Hierarchy selected. The following explains the process in detail. To select where the Item Group should appear on the Point of Sale (POS), go to the Back Office and click on "Shops" from the options list. Choose the appropriate location and take note of the Primary Group and Tax Group information to ensure correct display on the POS. To view tax rates for a specific Item Hierarchy, go to "Inventory" in the menu and select "Item Hierarchies". Choose the desired Node and click on the edit icon to see the assigned tax rates and make adjustments if needed. If adjustments are necessary, refer to the "Create Hierarchies Root Node" section for guidance. Note: You can only select one tax code per tax group. To set up Item Hierarchies for your groups, navigate to "Groups" in the Back Office. Create a new group (and set it as the Primary Group for your shop) or edit an existing group. Ensure that the Item Hierarchy list on the Group Details page includes the desired hierarchy for display on the Point of Sale (PoS). Save any changes made. When launching your shop's PoS, the "Item Groups" button will show the groups set up in the previous step. Click on the "Item Groups" button from the menu to access it. The configured Item Groups can be viewed in the centre panel using this feature. To sell items under a specific Item Group, simply click on it and enter the desired selling price when prompted. If you have multiple Item Groups, use the filter buttons at the bottom to refine your list. Clicking on a filter button will display the filter, and you can further narrow down the list using the search box. Additionally, the "Sort By" option allows you to arrange your Item Groups by ID number or Name. The Reset button will clear any applied filters. The cancel button will return you to the Transaction screen.

title: Item Shortcuts
text: An Item can be selected to be shown as a Hotkey under the right hand Item Shortcuts button. Item Shortcuts are managed @Here in Item Hierarchy. Select Item Shortcuts from the right hand menu. Item Shortcuts are displayed in the POS by folder levels. Click on the folder to display the items. Find and click on the item you require this will add the item to the transaction. By selecting cancel you will be taken back to the Receipt View.

title: Gift Certificate
text: You can sell/issue a Gift Certificate via the PoS which can then be redeemed as a tender in any of your shops. Note: It is not possible to apply a discount to a Gift Certificate at the PoS, irrespective of the settings in the Miscellaneous Tab. Gift Certificates are multi-currency. They are generated based on the stores base currency and you can redeem the voucher in any store that supports that currency. If a store does not support that currency it will report the certificate number as not found. Tap the Create Gift Certificate button to create one. The soft keyboard will appear Key in the value of the Gift Certificate to confirm press enter on the keyboard or the soft keyboard. Note: The screen will show the created Gift Certificate and the generated number. This number is a combination of the Store, POS and Transaction Numbers. You can perform other functions on the Gift Certificate whilst it is in the basket. You can Discount using the standard methods including Line Price - but please note this does not affect the value of the gift certificate - only the price paid for it. You can add as many gift certificates to the transaction as required When you pay for your transaction, you will receive an individual slip of paper representing each Gift Certificate from the receipt printer. Email Gift Receipt If the customer asks for the Gift Receipt to be emailed to them this can be done at the end of the transaction. Note: This has to be activated via the portal in POS Admin > POS Options. Once the customer has paid for their Gift Receipt select Enter the customer's email address or the address given and press A notification of the email success will appear in the top right.

title: Sell Set
text: NOTE: The Sell Set feature is intended to be deprecated after April 2023. You should consider using PPE Promotions instead. Sell Set allows you to sell a selection of items together for a fixed price. For example, you may sell a Shirt, a Tie and a pair of cufflinks and give them to the customer for €100. Press the Sell Set button on the menu to include items into a set. The transaction screen changes to show you this. Anything you scan or search for will be bundled together into the "Set" except for any items marked as “POS Block Discount” or Item Group. Neither of these types of items can be added to a Sell Set. Items will be added as individual lines and not aggregated. This is similar to the option POS Block Quantity Entry. It is possible to add a Prompt For Price item to a Sell Set but such items are given the price you enter. Any discount available from the Sell Set promotion is apportioned across the other items in the Sell Set. At least two or more items must be included in your set. When you have included everything you want in your set click the OK button or tap the Enter Amount box to key in the price you want to sell the set for. It will pop open the Soft Keyboard for you to enter a value. Press the Green Tick to apply the total price for the Set. A set must have a value greater than 0 (zero) to be valid. Once the price is entered it cannot be altered. To change the price of a set you should delete the set and start again Tap the Enter Amount box to key in the price you want to sell the set for. It will pop open the Soft Keyboard for you to enter a value. press the Green Tick to apply the price. NOTE: There are set denominations for quick use. The transaction then gets the discount split across the transaction lines and quantities. When an item is part of a set you cannot make changes to individual components of that set. Selecting one of the items will allow you to either Delete the whole set, set the item as a Gift or change the Clerk. NOTE: Pressing the Delete option on any set item will remove the entire set. To make changes to a set once the price has been applied will require you to delete the set and start again. You can continue adding additional items to the basket and make your payment when ready as per any other transaction.

title: Make Expenses
text: Making an Expense is a way to charge expenses to the till. For example, for cleaning, staff welfare etc. These are configured in the back office/Expenses To make an expense in the POS press the Make Expense button. Choose the item group you want to associate the expense to. You will then be asked to key in the expense amount using the Soft Keyboard. It will then add a line to the POS basket. Here you can change the Line Clerk, Delete the Line or add a Comment to the expense. Adding a comment is recommended. An expense transaction can only be completed against the Cash payment type. You can then complete the transaction and issue the money. A receipt will be printed to track this.

title: Parked Transactions
text: The Park transactions feature is designed for when you want to suspend a transaction in its full state without losing it. There are several reasons for this. such as the customer forgetting their wallet and will come back later, or where the POS device is shared between Clerks. To park a transaction you must have an item(s) or a customer assigned to the transaction. Click the Park Transaction button, this will revert the POS to the login page. NOTE: A new transaction can be started, completed and even many more after that. The parked notes are safely held for recall at a later stage. When you have logged back into the POS click the Parked Transactions in the left-hand menu. This will list all Parked transactions you have in your Store. It will show you the Date, Time, Value and Clerk Number. You can also tap it to expand it and see what is on the note. And from here you choose to Delete the parked transaction, or recall it back to the Basket to complete the transaction.

title: Find Receipt
text: The Find Receipt button lets you search for previous transactions and either reprint or return them. The page will show the most recent transactions in a list. Click the required transaction and it will expand with options. You can choose to reprint, print a gift receipt (if set up in the back office E-Mail Receipt will show) or the option to return the item. You can locate a specific receipt by using the Toggle Filters which will display a pop-up. Search using a date filter range, as well as being able to search for all stores Choose a date range and enter a search string. You can search based on the following values: Clerk's name or number Customer Number Date Transaction Amount Payment Type Receipt Barcode Item Barcode Item No Item Comment Transaction Type (Sale, Return, Exchange) A list of receipts will be displayed, tap to expand the receipt you wish to view. If you cannot see your receipt then click Show More Results to bring back any further receipts (receipts are shown in batches of 100 at a time) You can then reprint the receipt, create a Return from it or print a Gift Receipt for the transaction. The Find Receipt also displays Cash Statements which you can view and reprint. Cancel will return you to the PoS transaction screen

title: Reprint Last Receipt
text: You can print a duplicate copy of the last receipt in two different ways. Clicking the Reprint Last within the right-hand menu. Or select the ellipses ... in the top right and select Print Last Receipt.

title: Void Transaction
text: To Void a transaction. Press the button and scan the receipt barcode to perform a reverse of the transaction.

title: Cancel Sale
text: The Cancel Sale button will abort the current transaction in any state and return you to the Login screen.

title: Journals
text: The Journals feature allows you to reprint a batch of receipts, which could be useful when reconciling your till. It's accessed through the Ellipsis button. Then click the Journals button from the list. From the Journals page, you can choose which dates you require. You can either Print terminal journal, for EFT receipts, or Print receipt journal, for standard sales receipts. Click Cancel to return to the POS

title: Email Receipt
text: Email Receipt Functionality Imagine supports an Email Receipt feature that allows you to send a standardized email receipt upon the completion of a transaction. You can use the Email Receipt button to initiate this process. Please note that the format of the email receipt is fixed and cannot be customized. Using the Email Receipt Function To use the Email Receipt function, ensure that your Point of Sale (POS) system is online and has an active Internet connection. If your POS shows as offline or if there is no Internet connection, the Email Receipt function will not be available. Sending Email Receipts while Offline If you attempt to send an email receipt while offline, it will not be delivered. In such cases, it is recommended to provide a paper copy of the receipt instead. Failed Email Notifications In some cases, email notifications may fail to be delivered. If you encounter this issue, you can try adding the following IP address to your whitelist: 149.72.233.183. This might help in ensuring that the email notifications are successfully delivered. Note: Whitelisting the above IP address should only be done if you have confirmed that email notifications are failing to be delivered.

title: Account Deposit
text: When a customer is attached to a transaction via the widget menu you can make deposits to their account. This can be if they owe you money, or perhaps they want to pre-load an account with money to be paid. The button appears only when a customer is attached to the transaction.

title: Picklist Report
text: The Pick List Report is used to print a list of the item(s) that have been sold in a user-determined period. This print will be to the receipt printer. Picklist Reports are generally used as a restocking list, the clerk may print this list, check the item(s) sold, see what is on the shelf/rail for that item(s) and replenish stock from the stock room if the shelf/rail is low. This function can be performed several times a day. Picklist Type - Select between Vendors- Hierarchy or Hierarchy - Vendors. Order By - Choose between Item No, Item Name, Item Description or Vendor Item No. Since the last print - Tick this box to print a list based on all sales since the last time you ran a Picklist Report. This can be useful if you don’t know the last time the report was run. Start Date - The first date you want the Picklist Report to include. End Date - The last date you want the Picklist Report to include. NOTE: ‘Since last print’ and ‘Start Date/End Date’ are exclusive, you can only choose one or the other, not both. Cancel - This will return you to the POS main transaction screen. The printed-out picklist will show. Shop name Start and End dates and times for the sales included in the report Date and time the Picklist Report was printed A list of items sold in the selected period with Sold showing how many were sold in this period Returned showing how many were returned in this period Net showing the result of Sold minus Returned The number On-Hand currently for this item Totals showing a sum of all Sold, Returned and the Net figure

title: Hardware Information
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Connector Printers Label Printers Cash Drawers Scanners Barcode Scanners NCR SCO tri-Light CONNECTOR The Connector, developed by K3, is a Linux-based (x86_64) server device that serves as a point-of-sale hardware station. It allows for browser-based printing and can connect to a cash drawer. It is important to note that an Ethernet connection is required, and it must be connected to the network through a CAT5e cable or higher. The Connector is compatible with two types of printers: K3-manufactured printers and Epson T88V printers. Additionally, any Epson-compatible cash drawer connected to the same printers is also supported. PRINTERS The K3 Thermal Receipt Printer is a 40-column receipt printer, similar to an Epson T88, that is manufactured by K3. It requires a serial connection (9-pin) and features an onboard Drawer Kicker, which can be used to activate the connected cash drawer. The Epson T88V is another standard printer that requires a serial connection (25-pin) and also includes an onboard Drawer Kicker for the connected cash drawer. It's important to note that specific dip switch settings are necessary for the TM88V, which can be found in the installation instructions for the printer. The ODP333 is a 40-column receipt printer, similar to an Epson T88, that is manufactured by Aures. For this printer, baud settings may need to be adjusted and logos must be flashed to the printer memory. LABEL PRINTERS The Citizen CL-S521 is the sole label printer that is supported and uses thermal direct printing. It's important to note that while other label printers that support the ZPL language and feature a serial port may function properly, they are not directly supported by K3. CASH DRAW K3 Cash Drawer - This is manufactured by K3 using an Epson Compatible Drawer Kick port. Any Epson-compatible Cash Drawer. SCANNERS To ensure the proper functioning of any scanner used with the POS software, it must be able to support and run "Keyboard Wedge" via USB, PS/2, or Bluetooth. We recommend testing the scanner with any barcode labels in use, whether pre-printed on products or printed in-house, as well as scanning the receipt barcode to ensure that the output precisely matches the data represented by the barcode. To run a simple test, scan the barcode into a text editor such as Notepad or TextEdit and compare the data to the barcode. Please note that some options within Imagine enable simultaneous printing to both label and receipt printers, such as gift receipt/label printing. If only one printer is being used, the connector will attempt to print to the only available device if these options are selected, which may result in random characters appearing on either labels or receipts. If this occurs, please check the settings within Imagine and use only the available device. BARCODE SCANNER Imagine has been found to work seamlessly with both USB and Bluetooth scanners that are set to keyboard wedge mode. However, as there are numerous types of platforms, browsers, connection types, and driver requirements, K3 cannot provide an exhaustive list of the compatible scanner makes and models. NCR SCO TRI-LIGHT The NCR SCO tri-light requires the SCO Agent to be running to function. This can be installed by your local K3 representative or by contacting your local K3 Support.

title: Connections / Networks / Requirements
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Imagine Requirements Approved for use of URLs Whitelisted IP Address Port Numbers Supported Browsers Network Capabilities Imagine Requirements Before selecting any of our devices, we advise that you perform User Acceptance Testing since we cannot ensure that the Imagine Platform is compatible with every hardware and browser combination. A touch screen and/or a keyboard and mouse (with scroll wheel) combination are required. Windows devices with a minimum screen resolution of (1024x768) Android devices with a minimum screen resolution of (1024x768) iPhone and Android phones/small-screen devices are recommended as the minimum for K3 TOP. iPad and Android tablets are recommended as the minimum for Order Ready Board and Order Status Display. Approved for use of URLs The following URLs must be granted outbound access through any firewalls or proxies which are set up on the network. k3imagine.com k3rnd.com dddretail.com Whitelisted IP Address NOTE: In the event of email notifications failing to be delivered you may need to add the following IP to your whitelist-149.72.233.183 For more details see Email the Receipt. Port Numbers The following ports must be opened to allow traffic for certain apps and parts of Imagine to work. *For integrated card terminals there may be additional requirements beyond these ports HTTP Port 80 HTTPS Port 443 Supported Browsers Imagine is designed to work on the following browsers via Windows, Linux and OSX machines. Edge (v83.0 or later) Chrome (v80 or later) Firefox (v61 or later) Safari (v14 or later) Opera (v67 or later) The supported browsers on iOS, Android, and Windows 10 Mobile are the same. However, some functionality may be limited, such as the inability to run apps in full screen on iOS. We do not have a minimum version number requirement for these browsers on mobile devices. Although K3 provides version numbers for supported browsers on desktop machines, we recommend enabling automatic browser updates for security purposes and using the latest version of the browser whenever possible. Network Capabilities Imagine functions like any other web page on devices with a stable Wi-Fi or Ethernet connection. For devices connected to a mobile service, we recommend a stable 10Mb 4G connection or better, or at least a 3G connection. Please note that the quality of the connection affects the rendering and performance of Imagine.

title: Assembling the Connector
text: The Connector is the HUB for all of your connections and software. Assemble the power block and insert the power cable into the DC in port on the Connector. Be sure to remove the Power Cable from the Connector by pulling the sleeve back and not by forcing the cable as this may cause damage to the cable and pins. Connect the printer to the Connector using the supplied USB cable. Connect the cash drawer to the printer using the supplied DK cable. Connect the Connector to your network (router) using the supplied network cable. Note that your network must support DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) and allow the device to be assigned an IP address that has outgoing Internet access. Press the On button to power on the Connector. Wait a few moments for the Connector to connect to the Internet. A blue LED will indicate that the Connector is powered on. Check into the K3 servers and print a status report. This report will have the IP address and Unit ID you need to add via the K3 Connector Manager. Note that when adding a new Connector and configuring it to a store, it may take up to 10 minutes to complete. When it has finished, you will receive a startup notification printout. Note that if the Startup Complete slip prints without an IP address, you should check your network settings and router. A missing IP address means the Connector has not been issued an IP address automatically. Example of a Startup Slip Example of a Startup Complete Slip

title: Changing the K3 Printer Language
text: If you need to use a different language on the K3 Printer, you can follow these steps to set the language within the printer itself: Download the printer tool from https://rongtatech.com/RP820_download and connect the thermal printer to your computer. Note the COM port it connects to, which can be found in the device manager. Start up the PrinterTool.exe and configure the printer by setting the COM port to the one it's connected to and hit "Configure the port." Set the baud rate to 38400 and then hit "Set Printer." On the first tab, set the code page to "CHINESE" and set the baud rate to 38400. Hit "Set" and the printer should beep. On the "BIG5" tab, set the emulation mode to "EPSON ESC/POS" and language to "Chinese GB 18030." Hit "Set" on both options. On the first tab again, hit "Self-Test." The printer should print out its configuration, and the code page at the top should now read "GBK" along with some Chinese characters. Unplug the printer and plug it back into your connector, then reboot your connector. SSH onto the connector and change the docker-compose.yml file by adding the following configuration to the arm gateway container as an environment variable: "EncodingCodePageValue: 54936" Reboot your connector again.

title: Connector Issues
text: Please note that the following list is non exhaustive, and if you are still experiencing difficulties connecting, please do not hesitate to contact the relevant local support team within K3 @Support - K3 (k3btg.com). Here are some troubleshooting steps: Check the power, USB, and Ethernet connections. Make sure the correct connector is selected via the POS using the USB icon. A green bar indicates the selected connector is working as expected. A red flashing bar indicates there is a problem with the selected connector. A green dot indicates the connector is available but not selected. A red dot indicates there is an issue with the connector. Ensure everything is connected correctly. See @Installing Hardware for more information. Make sure only the supplied hardware is plugged into the connector. Note that the Wi-Fi connector on the rear of the unit should not be relied on for connectivity. We advise a hardwired connection. If the connector is being used with just a label printer alone, the label printer must still be plugged into the lower USB port. Check that the connector is plugged in, the power cable and brick are assembled correctly, and the socket is switched on. Ensure the Ethernet cable is plugged into a live socket, router, or otherwise attached to LAN. If a live Ethernet connection is not available when the connector boots, it will wait 5 minutes before defaulting to the previously cached IP, and it will continue to boot. If your connector prints the start-up slip, but you still cannot connect and the boot time has been longer than normal, we recommend you connect a screen to the connector to check it's not waiting for an IP address to be issued by DHCP. Ensure the Ethernet connection is working by using another compatible device. Make sure the receipt printer is powered on and connected via the USB/Serial Converter before booting the connector. Note that if any cables are removed while the connector is powered on, then the connector must be rebooted. Check if there is sufficient paper in the receipt printer and if the lid is closed correctly. Ensure the printer is powered on and connected via the serial cable and USB/Serial Converter. Check if the start-up slip has been printed. If it's blank, check that the paper is correctly installed into the printer. If using an Epson TM88 printer, after 90 seconds of booting up, if the start-up slip has not been printed, check the DIP switches. If the start-up slip has printed, check for the IP address. If there is no IP shown, please check your router and network setup. Check if the connector is listed in Platform Admin. You should be able to see a local IP address and a 'last seen' date. If the connector is listed but there is no IP, contact K3. If the POS is showing the connector as offline (red flashing dot), this is often a sign the certificate is not installed correctly. Please check in the Certificate Manager for your operating system for the certificate, and if necessary, re-install. Ensure the connector is set up in Admin. The ID must match the unit ID on the printed slip. Note that the hex code should be exactly 6 sets of numbers and letters and be separated by - not : as displayed on the start-up slip.

title: Installing an Epson TM88V
text: NOTE: The full TM88v manual can be found at https://files.support.epson.com/pdf/pos/bulk/tm-t88v_hwum_en_02.pdf Cable Selection To successfully connect to an Epson TM88v printer, you will need a 9-pin female to 25-pin male serial cable. The choice of cable is critical to ensure that the printer operates correctly. If you encounter printing issues despite having the correct setup, you may need to consider swapping the cable for a different brand or make. Additionally, since the connector only offers USB ports, you will need a Serial to USB converter to establish the connection. If you require further guidance, please consult your K3 Consultant for advice. Baud Speed - Hardware Setting You will require a crosshead screwdriver to physically adjust the DIP switches. Before proceeding, ensure that the TM88v is switched off and unplugged from the main power supply. Next, locate the metal cover on the underside of the TM88v. To configure the switches, set switches 7 and 8 to the on position on DSW1, but leave the other switches across both banks unchanged. After adjusting the switches, replace the metal cover, turn the TM88v over, and reconnect the power supply. Finally, power on the TM88v. To set the baud rate of the TM88v to 38400, you will need to adjust the hardware DIP switches as described in the previous instructions. Even if the self-test/Firmware Version printout indicates that the baud speed is already set to 38400, it is recommended to follow the steps below, as the values displayed in the printout can be inaccurate. To begin, power off the TM88v and then press and hold the Feed button while powering it on. Release the Feed button once the Firmware Version page has been printed, which will display both the Baud Rate and DIP Switch settings. These values need to be verified using the remaining steps outlined below. Press the Feed button for one second or more to print the Mode Selection page. Next, quickly press the Feed button three times, then press and hold the Feed button to display the Customize Value Settings page. Press the Feed button three times quickly, then press and hold the Feed button again to show the Baud Rate page. Verify that the default and current set values match the port settings, which should be 38400bps. To change the Current Set Value, press the Feed button quickly five times (38400bps), then press and hold the Feed button for more than one second. The new baud rate will be displayed as "Saved." Finally, turn off the TM88v and turn it back on without pressing or holding the Feed button. Below is an excerpt of the Serial Interface settings for the DIP switches. Highlighted are the relevant parts for setting the Baud speed to 38400.

title: Logs
text: Logs are used to display manual stock adjustments for a given date range and shop. Manual stock adjustments are performed in Stock Lookup - Adjustments The filters available are From Date To Date Shop Item Number User Name After making the selection and clicking "Filter Table" the list of movements will be displayed. Column Chooser Use this button to add additional columns to the data grid. Columns can be removed in the same way. Export All Data Use the Export All Data button to export a list. The file will be named "DataGrid", and will show the same data as the data grid on-screen, including any added or removed columns.

title: Stock Lookup Overview
text: The Stock Lookup Overview feature provides a convenient way to view essential information about stocks for a chosen item. When you first access the overview, you'll see a search box. If you click the search button without entering any specific query, it will display all available items. To find a particular item, you can enter either its item number or a description of the part. The overview will then generate a filtered list that matches your selection. By clicking on an item from the list, you can access detailed stock information for each shop.

title: Stock Lookup
text: Stock Lookup Shows detailed information about an item and allows direct adjustments to be made. You must select a Shop from the list of active shops. Enter an optional search query in the Search box, this can be an item number or name. Click Lookup, a list will be displayed if more than one item matches this selection. Click on the item row to view detail. Summary Tab This screen displays the current information for this item. Adjustments Tab You can adjust stock by choosing Adjust as a Reason Code from the drop-down menu, Adjust to the correct QTY and clicking. As an example, if the value 20 is entered in the Current Stock box, after clicking adjust the value will become 20. Purchase Order Actions This tab can be used to add the selected item to an existing Purchase Order or Create a new Purchase Order. Print Label Settings This option allows the printing of barcodes to a chosen connector and label template.

title: Offline Stock
text: Offline stock is a list of stock entries that are separate from the main inventory. Offline stock is not included in On hand figures Typically this is stock which is faulty or otherwise not available for sale to customers. The offline stock list is used for viewing, managing and adding stock that has been separated from the main inventory. The reason for separating stock might be due to a sold item being returned via the POS refund, however, due to the nature of the return, this item is i.e. broken or not fit for use it cannot be available for purchase again and must be separated. Stock can also be added directly offline from the main inventory. Add to offline allows the user to add stock to the offline inventory. Search Term Allows the user to search for items within the Offline Stock. Shop Drop-down to select a shop to filter on. Vendor Drop-down to select a Vendor to filter on. Hierarchy Drop-down to select a Hierarchy to filter on. Search Search allows the user to find information on items added to the offline inventory. Leaving the filters empty and pressing search will pull everything back. The "Add To Offline" button allows the user to go through the process of adding offline stock using filters. Add to Offline Add to offline allows the user to add stock to the offline inventory. Search Term Allows the user to search for items within the Offline Stock. Shop Drop-down to select a shop to filter on. Vendor Drop-down to select a Vendor to filter on. Hierarchy Drop-down to select a Hierarchy to filter on. Search Search allows the user to find information on items added to the offline inventory. Leaving the filters empty and pressing search will pull everything back. Use the + button to add to the Quantity to be made offline. Use the – button to take away from any Quantity that has been added. Use the edit button to directly overtype a value into the Quantity field Cancels any changes that have been made to the quantities. Saves any changes that have been made to commit the offline changes.

title: Dashboard
text: The Dashboard is an overview of how the company is performing, shown in the form of graphs and key performance figures. From the Date Filter and Shop Selection filter, you can break down the overview into specific periods and by the individual shop. Key Performance Figures Graphs Total Revenue by Hour Excluding Vat. Total Number of Sales by Hour. Top Sellers by Revenue. Top Sellers by Quantity. Average Transaction Value by Hour. Top right of some graphs is a corresponding summary value. NOTE: There is no print option for the Dashboard reports.

title: Store Sale Summary
text: The Store Sale Summary report offers a comprehensive overview of the company's sales performance. The report can be presented in two formats: a Table displaying figures and Graphs illustrating trends. By utilizing the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can analyze sales figures for specific periods and individual shops. This allows for a more detailed breakdown of the sales data. Furthermore, the report provides additional filter options that enable you to customize the view. You can add or remove columns based on your preferences and adjust the Summary Boxes to display the desired information. Please note that the data in the report excludes Gift Certificates or Expenses, focusing solely on sales-related information.

title: Financial Summary
text: The Financial Summary report offers a comprehensive analysis of the company's performance from a financial perspective. It provides detailed information regarding financial data. Using the Date Picker and Shop Selection filter, you can narrow down the report to specific periods and individual shops, allowing for a more focused analysis of the financial data. Please note that the Dashboard reports, including the Financial Summary report, do not have a print option. They are designed to be viewed and analyzed within the system, without the ability to generate physical printouts. Key Performance Figures Total Sales Average Basket Amount Average Basket Number of Items Financial Data Summary: List of Report Fields Transaction Analysis Description Number of Transactions Number of items Amount. Discount Analysis Description Number of Transactions Original Amount Discounted Amount Discount Discount Reason Code Analysis Description Number of Transactions Original Amount Discounted Amount Discount Return Analysis Description Number of items Value Cash Statement for Connector Description Currency Code Amount Payment Methods Description Number of Transactions Total Tax Analysis Description Net Amount Tax Amount Total Time Analysis Graph Additional Financial data is shown on the Time Analysis graph if you hover the pointer/mouse over the data points.

title: Clerk Sale Summary
text: The Clerk Sale Summary report focuses on providing sales performance information based on individual clerks and their respective sales transactions. The report offers two presentation options: a Data Table displaying figures and Graphs for visual representation. By utilizing the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can narrow down the sales figures to specific periods and individual shops, enabling a more detailed analysis of the sales data specific to each clerk. Moreover, the report provides additional filter options that allow you to customize the view. You can add or remove columns based on your preferences and modify the Summary Boxes to display the desired information related to clerk sales performance.

title: Master Item Summary Sale
text: The Master Item Sale Summary report offers a detailed analysis of the company's performance from a Master Item perspective. The report is presented as a Data Table, providing comprehensive figures and information. Using the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can segment the sales figures based on specific periods and individual shops. This allows for a more granular breakdown of the sales data related to each Master Item. Additionally, the report provides further filter options that give you the flexibility to customize the view. You can add or remove columns according to your preferences and adjust the Summary Boxes to display the desired information related to Master Item sales performance.

title: Item Sale Summary
text: The Item Sale Summary report provides a detailed analysis of the company's performance specifically related to Variant Items. The report is presented as a Data Table, offering comprehensive figures and information. By utilizing the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can segment the sales figures based on specific periods and individual shops. This allows for a more focused breakdown of the sales data related to each Variant Item. Furthermore, the report provides additional filter options that allow you to customize the view according to your preferences. You can add or remove columns based on the desired information and adjust the Summary Boxes to display the specific metrics or summaries that are relevant to Variant Item sales performance.

title: Vendor Sale Summary
text: The Vendor Sale Summary report offers detailed insights into the company's performance from a Vendor perspective. The report can be presented as a Data Table containing figures and also as Graphs for visual representation. By using the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can analyze the sales figures for specific periods and individual shops, allowing for a detailed breakdown of Vendor-related sales data. Additionally, the report provides additional filter options to customize the view. You can add or remove columns based on your preferences and modify the Summary Boxes to display specific metrics or summaries relevant to Vendor sales performance. This flexibility allows you to tailor the report to your specific needs and gain a deeper understanding of how the company is performing with different Vendors.

title: Customer Sale Summary
text: The Customer Sale Summary report provides a table view that showcases the customer's non-Account Sales, Account Sales, and Points status. It offers insights into the customer's purchasing behaviour and loyalty program engagement. By utilizing the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can segment the sales figures based on specific periods and individual shops. This allows for a more detailed breakdown of the sales data related to each customer. Furthermore, the report offers additional filter options, giving you the flexibility to customize the view according to your preferences. You can add or remove columns based on the desired information and adjust the Summary Boxes to display specific metrics or summaries relevant to customer sales and loyalty program performance.

title: Footfall Summary
text: The Footfall Summary report offers detailed information on conversion rates for a shop, specifically comparing sales and revenue to the number of customers entering and exiting the shop. The report provides both Graphs and a Data Table for visual and numerical analysis. By utilizing the Date Picker and Shop Selection filters, you can break down the footfall figures into specific time periods, individual shops, and even by clerks if desired. This allows for a more comprehensive analysis of conversion rates based on various factors. Additionally, the report provides additional filter options that allow you to customize the view according to your preferences. You can add or remove columns to focus on specific metrics or information that is relevant to your analysis. This flexibility enables a more tailored and insightful examination of footfall and conversion rates for your shops.

title: Store Sale Report
text: The Store Sale Report provides figures that allow for a comparison of store performance using various metrics. One of the metrics available for comparison is the Square Metres of each shop. You have the option to include or exclude this metric based on your needs for a relative comparison. To activate or deactivate the Square Metres metric, you can use the toggle located on the right-hand side of the report. By including or excluding Square Metres, you can gain insights into the performance of stores while considering their respective sizes. This feature helps provide a more accurate and fair comparison among stores in the report.

title: Item Hierarchies
text: Please note that currently, it is not feasible to relocate or reposition hierarchy nodes within the hierarchy structure. This section provides you with the ability to handle the Hierarchy Nodes, often referred to as Departments and Categories.
